frame_definition: An Agent leaves behind a Theme effectively rendering it no longer within their control or of the normal security as one's property.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person who acts to leave behind the Theme. The Theme is the entity that is relinguished to no one from the Agent's possession. The location where the Agent gives up the Theme. When the Agent gives up the Theme. The style in which the Agent gives up the Theme. For what expanse of time the Agent has given up the Theme. Explanation denotes a proposition from which the act of abandonment logically follows. The role Depictive describes the Agent during the abandoning event. The extent to which the Agent leaves the Theme behind. An action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. The purpose for which the Agent abandons the Theme. A description of the event as a whole.

frame_definition: In this frame an Abuser repeatedly treats the Victim in a cruel and violent way, including physically harming or forcing the Victim to engage in sexual activity against their will.
role_definitions: The Abuser subjects the Victim to repeated verbal, physical, emotional or sexual attacks. The Victim is the recipient of the Abuser's actions. Type is used for the domain in which the Abuser mistreats the Victim. Degree is the extent to which the abuse occurs. This role identifies the Place where the abuse occurs. This role identifies the Time when the abuse occurs. Manner is used for any description of the abuse event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Abuser that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). This role identifies the Means by which the Abuser accomplishes the abuse. An entity used by the Abuser to accomplish the abuse. An action that the Abuser intends to accomplish by performing the abuse. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. The amount of time that abuse occurs. How often abuse occurs. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The length of time from when the Abusing event began to be repeated to when it stopped.

frame_definition: A Cognizer introduces a New_idea into society.
role_definitions: The Cognizer comes up with or conceptualizes the New_idea. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: The New_idea is a concept not previously present in society which the Cognizer introduces. This role identifies the Time when the Cognizer comes up with the New_idea. This role identifies the Place where the Cognizer comes up with the New_idea. This role identifies the Means by which the Cognizer accomplishes the innovative achievement. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Cognizer creates the New_idea . This role identifies the Explanation for which the Cognizer created the New_idea. The Field is the general domain of endeavor to which the Cognizer is contributing and of which the New_idea is a part. An entity used by the Cognizer to achieve the introduction of the New_idea into society. Any description of the creative event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a Cognizer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The conceptual material from which the Cognizer invents the New_idea. The Location_of_appearance is where the Invention is first discovered by others.

frame_definition: An Agent finishes an Activity, which can no longer logically continue.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Depictive phrase describing an actor or an undergoer of an action. This role identifies the Manner an Agent is engaged in finishing an Activity. This role identifies the Result of finished Activity. This role identifies the last Co-timed_event of the finished Activity. This role identifies the Place where the Agent finishes the Activity. This role identifies the Time when the Activity finishes. This role identifies the Agent who has finished an Activity. This role identifies the Activity that the Agent has finished. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent finishes an Activity. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent finishes for an Activity. This role describes the how near the agent is to finishing. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role identifies an event during which the Agent finishes the Activity.

frame_definition: An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. ''
role_definitions: This role identifies the Activity for which an Agent is pausing. An Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. This role identifies the Manner in which an Agent pauses during the course of an Activity. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. This role identifies the Place where an Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. This role identifies the Time at which an Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent pauses in the course of an Activity. This role is used for the Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action. The extent to which the Agent pauses in the Activity. The length of time of the pause in the Activity. This role describes the legal basis or precedent by which the Agent pauses the Activity. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.

frame_definition: The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Protagonist in the initial state of an activity. The action that the Protagonist is prepared to do. An entity which stands in metonymically for the Activity. The time when the Protagonist is ready. The state or event that follows due to the ready state. The length of time that the Protagonist remains capable of the Activity without beginning it. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.

frame_definition: An Agent resumes participation in an Activity.
role_definitions: The amount of Time for which the Activity is resumed The Activity which is being resumed by the Agent. Where the event takes place. The Explanation for which the Activity is resumed. When the Activity is resumed. Any description of the Activity which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also mark indications of salient characteristics of the Agent which affect the Activity. The Agent who resumes an Activity that they were engaged in earlier. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. his role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. The consequence of the resuming of the Activity. n general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole.

frame_definition: An Agent initiates the beginning of an ongoing Activity in which he will be continuously involved. ''
role_definitions: This role identifies the Place where the Agent starts an Activity. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent engages in a starting Activity. This role identifies the Time when the Agent starts an Activity. This role identifies the Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action. This role identifies the Manner in which an Agent starts an Activity. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent starts an Activity. This role identifies the Activity that an Agent starts. This role identifies the being that starts the intentional Activity. This role identifies the first Co-timed_event of the started Activity. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role identifies an event during which the Agent starts the Activity. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. I Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. A consecutive event to the starting of the Activity of the Agent. This role indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as 'officially,' 'formally,' 'technically,' etc.). This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

frame_definition: An Agent ceases an Activity without completing it. ''
role_definitions: This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent stopped the Activity. This role identifies the Place where the Agent stops the Activity. This role identifies the Time when the Agent stops the Activity. This role is used for a Depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action. This role identifies the Manner in which the Agent stops the Activity. This role identifies the Result of the stopped Activity. This role identifies Agent that stops the Activity. This role identifies the Activity that the Agent stops. This role identifies the length of Time during which the Activity is stopped. This role identifies the Means by which the Agent stops the Activity. This role identifies the last Co-timed_event of the stopped Activity. This role describes the completeness of stopping. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. This role identifies an event during which the Agent stops the Activity. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The reason the Agent stops the Activity. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.

frame_definition: An Agent changes a Part of a complex entity with regard to some Feature in order to achieve some Imposed_purpose affected by the Feature.
role_definitions: The individual that controls the value of a Feature. The part of the complex entity which is changed in the process of adjusting. The Feature with respect to which the Part is adjusted. The state of the Part with respect to the Feature that the Agent brings about by making the adjustment. The action performed by the Agent which affects the Part. The location where the adjusting takes place. The time at which the adjusting occurs. The value associated with the Feature that the system ends up in. An entity manipulated by the Agent to adjust the Part and Feature. The state-of-affairs that the Agent hopes to bring about by adjusting. Any description of the adjustment act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A characterization of the amount that the Final_value and Initial_value differ. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

frame_definition: In this frame an Agriculturist cultivates Food.
role_definitions: The Agriculturist is the agent cultivating Food. Food is the item cultivated by the Agriculturist. The Instrument is used by the Agriculturist as a tool to help obtain Food. (This tool is not limited to typical artifacts and can be hands, arms, and other atypical hunting and fishing instruments.) For what length of time the Agriculturist attempted to obtain Food. The Manner in which the Agriculturist cultivates Food. This role identifies the Means by which the Agriculturist cultivates Food. The failure or success of an attempt. The greater geographic location where the Agriculturist cultivates Food. When the agricultural event occurs. An action that the Agriculturist intends to accomplish by cultivating Food. How often the Agriculturist cultivates Food. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. This is the the background or context for the Food to which the Agriculturist pays attention in his agricultural efforts. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role indicates the subtype of agriculture that the Agriculturist is engaging in. This role appraises the event. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the agricultural event itself and any of its participants.

frame_definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State has a feeling of annoyance as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic. 'Peck was annoyed at the interruption.'
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible Stimulus. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion.

frame_definition: A Cook applies heat to Food, where the Temperature_setting of the heat and Duration of application may be specified.
role_definitions: The Cook applies heat to the Food. This role identifes the entity that directly supplies heat to the Food. This role identifies the Place where the heat application occurs. Food is the entity to which heat is applied by the Cook. This role identifies the Time at which the heat application occurs. This role identifies the Means by which heat is applied to Food. This role identifies the Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. Duration is the amount of Time heat is applied to the Food. Medium is the substance through which heat is applied to the Food. Co-participant is the gramatically less prominent of two foods to which heat is applied by the Cook. This role identifies the Temperature_setting of the Heating_instrument for the Food. This role identifies the Degree to which heat application occurs. Any description of the cooking event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Cook that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Container holds the Food to which heat is applied. THe person for whose benefit the food is cooked.

frame_definition: A Selector, often an individual in a leadership role, appoints a Official to assume an official Role in an organization (which can be expressed as the Body).
role_definitions: The Selector is responsible for the appointment of the new official. Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs. The Official is a person appointed to a recognized position. Frequently, the Official is referred to only by his/her role. However, the Role can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement (headed by as). This role indicates the Degree to which an event occurs. Depictive indicates the state of one of the participants during the action. This role is used for the Manner of performing an action. This role identifies the Means by which the Selector accomplishes the designation of the Official. This role is used for indicating the Result of an event. This frame element describes the situation that brought about the new appointment. The Function is the purpose the Official will fufill. When the designation of the official takes place. Where the appointment takes place. A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function, and to which the Official is assigned.

frame_definition: At a court hearing, a Defendant is informed of the Charges against him or her, (usually) enters a plea, and a decision is made by a Judge as to the amount of bail, if any. ''
role_definitions: The Defendant is charged with a crime by a Judge. This role identifies the Place where the arraignment occurs. This role identifies the Time when the arraignment occurs. The Judge is the head of the court where the arraignment occurs. Charges is the crime with which the Defendant is charged. The length of time that the arraignment takes. Any description of the arraignment which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (openly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Judge that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: An Agent puts a complex Theme into a particular Configuration, which can be a proper order, a correct or suitable sequence, or a spatial position.
role_definitions: The person who causes the Theme to be in a particular Configuration. An entity that consists of parts which can be put into a configuration relative to each other and/or relative to their environment. The Time when the arranging takes place. A state that holds of the Theme or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the Theme as a result of the arranging action. Any description of the arranging action which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive use, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action ( eagerly, carefully). The place in which the Theme is put into a Configuration. Circumstances identifies the situation in which an Agent arranges a Theme. An action that the Agent is trying to bring about by changing the Configuration of the Theme. An entity used by the Agent to change the Theme's Configuration. An action performed by the Agent in order to arrange the Theme. The extent to which the Arranging act has occured.

frame_definition: Authorities charge a Suspect, who is under suspicion of having committed a crime (the Charges), and take him/her into custody.
role_definitions: Charges identifies a category within the legal system; it is the crime with which the Suspect is charged. This role identifies the Place where the arrest occurs. This role identifies the Time when the arrest occurs. The Authorities charge the Suspect with commiting a crime, and take him/her into custody. The Suspect is taken into custody, under suspicion of having committed a crime. This role indicates the subtype of arrest under which the Suspect is placed. Offense identifies the ordinary language use of the reason for which a Suspect is arrested. Any description of the arresting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Authorities that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). This role identifies the Means by which Authorities arrest a Suspect. This role identifies the purpose for which Authorities arrest a Suspect. The Source_of_legal_authority describe the law which grants the power of arrest to the Authorities. A person that participates in the event along with the Authorities or the Suspect.

frame_definition: An object Theme moves in the direction of a Goal.
role_definitions: Theme is the object that moves. It may be an entity that moves under its own power, but it need not be. Source is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While Source expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent. If present, they often express a general direction from which a Theme moves, rather than a landmark away from which it moves. Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal. In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense. Goal is any expression that tells where the Theme ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion. A Manner expression describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. This role identifies the Means by which a Theme arrives. The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Theme is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Theme. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'. Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique. This role identifies the Time when arriving occurs. The New_situation are the state of the Goal when the Theme arrives. The Depictive is a phrase which describes the state of the Theme upon arrival. The time period within which the arrival repeats multiple times. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Theme arrives to the Goal. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. This role marks the state of affairs reported by the Arriving Event as understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action. How often the Theme arrives at the Goal. This role identifies the Place where the arriving event occurs.

frame_definition: A Helper benefits a Benefited_party by enabling the culmination of a Goal that the Benefited_party has.
role_definitions: The Benefited_party receives a benefit from the action of the Helper. The Helper performs some action that benefits the Benefited_party. The desirable state of affairs that the Benefited_party is involved in and which is enabled by the Helper. This role identifies a Focal_entity involved in achieving the Goal. This role identifies the Time when the Assistance occurs. This role identifies the Place where the Assistance occurs. This role identifies the Manner in which a Helper assists a Benefited_party. An action that the Helper undertakes in service of the Benefited_party's Goal. An entity used by the Helper in service of the Benefited_party's accomplishing their Goal. The aspect of accomplishing the Goal to which the Helper's assistance is relevant. The measure to which the Helper's assistance brings the Benefited_party closer to accomplishing their Goal. The time period during which the Helper gives assistence to the Benefited_party. The situation that the Helper wishes to bring about by helping the Benefited_party to acheive the Goal. Note that this role should normally be used only when this situation is separate from the Goal. The frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the questions how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs; Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases.

frame_definition: An Agent has committed a Wrong in the past and is making Amends for it.
role_definitions: The Agent has committed a Wrong and is making Amends. Wrong identifies the act committed by the Agent for which Amends are made. Amends marks expressions that indicate what the Agent does to compensate for the Wrong that was committed. This role marks expressions that indicate the Degree to which Amends made are adequate for atoning the Wrong. The situation that the Agent hopes to bring about by atoning. Any description of the atonement which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The time at which the Agent atones for the Wrong. The location at which the Agent expiates the Wrong.

frame_definition: The Attaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically connected to something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be connected to each other.
role_definitions: The Agent manipulates an object. Agent typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects. It is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs. This role identifies the Item that the Agent attaches to the Goal. This role identifies the Result of an attaching event. Goal identifies the location to which an Item is attached. The Connector forms the bond that maintains the Item or Items in a fixed position; it is usually expressed in a with-PP. This role identifies the plural Items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment. Thie Handle is the point of attachment on the Item to which the Agent attaches. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. This role identifies the Manner in which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. This role identifies the Place where the Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent intentionally affects an Item or Items. This role identifies the Time when the Agent intentionally affects the Item or Items. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent attaches an Item or Items. Typically, it transmits the force applied by the Agent, and is not left behind as a participant in the resultant Being_attached frame. This role identifies the Degree to which the Item ends up attached. This frame element is defined as the number of times the Attaching event occurs per some unit of time. The length of time from when the Attaching event began to be repeated to when it stopped. The time when the Attaching occurs.

frame_definition: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
role_definitions: This role is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's attack. An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim. The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault. This role identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim. A state of affairs that the Assailant is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim. The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of the Assailant or Victim while the attack occurs. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily. The Result of the attack on the Victim by the Assailant. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels. The number (or description of the number) of times an attack takes place over a period of time. The amount of time that the attack lasts. This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the goal of motion nor a landmark along the way.

frame_definition: An Agent attempts to achieve a Goal.
role_definitions: The Agent makes an attempt to achieve a Goal. The Goal is what the Agent attempts to achieve. The Outcome is the failure or success of an attempt to achieve a Goal. This role identifies the Means by which an attempt occurs. This role identifies the effort expended in an attempt. This role identifies the Time when the attempt occurs. The Depictive is a phrase which describes the Agent. The place where an attempt is made. The Manner in which the Agent makes the attempt. The time peiod over which the attempts take place. The reason for which the Agent attempts the Goal. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the attempt of the Agent to achieve the Goal. The area of work to which the Attempt event belongs. The conditions under which the the Agent attempts the Goal. This frame element is defined as the number of times the Attemping event occurs per some unit of time. The state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in desiring the Goal.

frame_definition: The Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act in some way that will help to bring about events or states described in the Content.
role_definitions: The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses. The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act. The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act. What the communication is about. The written or spoken material that contains a message that potentially influences the Addressee towards the Content. This role identifies the Manner in which an action is performed. Depictive identifies a phrase that describes the actor of an action. This role identifies the Means by which an action is performed. This role identifies the Degree to which an event occurs. The time at which the lobbying occurs. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The state of the world (independent of the event). The Group is the set of Speakers and Mediums within which the Attempt_suasion is occuring. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The location where the Speaker attemtps susaion on an Addressee. The reason for which the Speaker attempts to persuade the Addressee. An entity which the Speaker believes should participate in the action. The role in which the Salient_entity is used to try to persuade the Addressee.

frame_definition: An Agent goes to an Event and is present in a relatively non-participatory way.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person who chooses to make himself present at the Event. The Event is the deliberate set of happenings given at a particular time and place. The way in which the Agent went about going to the Event. Through what strategies and efforts the Agent made possible his attendance at the Event. The location where the Agent attends the Event. When the Agent attends the Event. Under what conditions the Agent goes to the Event. The reason why the Agent goes to the Event. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. This role describes the event as a whole.

frame_definition: This frame concerns a Perceiver's state of readiness to process and consider impressions of a Figure within a Ground.
role_definitions: The individual that pays attention to the Ground. The sensory field or subset of a sensory field that the Perceiver is attending to. The entity that the Perceiver is specifically focussing on within the Ground. The amount of attention that the Perceiver is paying to the Figure or Ground. The situation within which the Perceiver is alert. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a Perceiver that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An entity (or event) associated with a Perceiver that gives evidence for a Perceiver's attentiveness.

frame_definition: An Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation under certain Circumstances.
role_definitions: The Agent avoids an Undesirable_situation. This role identifies the Place where the avoiding occurs. This role identifies the Time when the avoiding occurs. This role identifies the Purpose avoiding occurs. This role identifies the situation that the Agent avoids. This role identifies the Means by which avoiding occurs. This role identifies the Manner in which avoiding occurs. This role identifies the Circumstances under which the Undesirable_situation is avoided. This role identifies the Degree to which avoiding occurs. This role identifies the Explanation for which avoiding occurs.

frame_definition: This frame covers a step in a criminal process in which a Judge decides whether the Accused should be released on bail, and, if so, what the amount of the bail should be. ''
role_definitions: At the time of bail setting, the Accused is held without bail/bond, released on his/her own recognizance, or required to give the Court a specific amount of money for bail. The Judge, as head of the Court, determines the Accused's bail. Status idenitifies the decision made with regard to bail. The possible statuses are 'without bail/bond', 'on one's own recognizance', or a specific amount of money required for bail. This role identifies the Time when the bail setting occurs. This role identifies the Place where the bail setting occurs. Any description of the bail setting which is not covered by more specific FEs, including, secondary effects (openly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Judge that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The method used by the Judge to set the bail. The purpose for which the Judge sets bail.

frame_definition: A Protagonist has (or does not have) a Weapon.
role_definitions: The amount of Weapons that the Protagonist has (relative to some standard). The destructive device that the Protagonist has with them. The individual that possesses a Weapon. The location where a Protagonist carries a Weapon. The time at which the Protagonist carries a Weapon.

frame_definition: An Entity ends up with some Final_quality--a new fact about the Entity.
role_definitions: Where the change takes place. >When the change occurs. How long the Entity remains in the Final_category, Final_situation, or Final_quality. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In cases where the Entity is intentional, Manner may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional Entity that also affect the event (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Entity which undergoes a change, newly ending up in the Final_category or taking on a new Final_quality. A description of a characteristic of the Entity after the change. The category that the Entity ends up in after the change. Typically, this entails taking on a number of new characteristics. The period during which the Entity is in transition. This role describes the state of the Entity before change occurs. This role marks the set of conditions under which the Entity enters the Final_category or takes on the characteristic of the Final_quality. This role describes the category of the Entity before a change. A description of the kind of entities associated with instances of the Entity and saliently affected by its change. Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the Entity.

frame_definition: A New_member becomes a member of a socially-constructed Group.
role_definitions: The New_member becomes a member of a (socially-defined) Group. This role identifies the place where the joining occurs. This role identifies the purpose for which the New_member joins the Group. This role identifies the time when the New_member joins the Group. This role identifies the Means by which the New_member becomes part of the group. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a New_member that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Frequency with which the New_member becomes a member of a Group. The Group is a socially-constructed entity composed of members. A factor that explains why the New_member joins the Group. The capacity or role in which the New_member is placed upon joining the Group. The state of the New_member when they join. This role denotes an event paired with that of the main clause, which explains why the event of the main clause is expected. In particular, reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished in the main clause, or an action that is paired with the action in the main clause as the other side of an agreement. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action.

frame_definition: An Entity loses moisture with the outcome of being in a dry state.
role_definitions: The Entity is the thing that loses moisture and becomes dry. The intensity with which the Entity becomes dry. The way in which the Entity becomes dry. The location where the Entity becomes dry. When the Entity becomes dry. The situation in which the Entity is becoming dry. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. This role indicates that the visiting is a particular instance in a series of repeated visiting events.

frame_definition: An Entity that is previously not visible to a Perceiver becomes visible.
role_definitions: The thing that the Perceiver is able to see or recognize. The person who is able to see the Entity. This role is often null-instantiated as it is deprofiled in this scene. A description of how the Entity becomes visible that is not covered by more specific FEs. The physical location in which the Entity becomes visible. A temporal description of the event of the Entity becoming visible.

frame_definition: An Item is attached by a Handle, via a Connector, to a Goal, or Items are attached to each other.
role_definitions: Connector identifies the instrument used to attach and is usually expressed in a with-PP. Handle identifies the point of attachment on the Item. Item identifies the entity that comes to be attached to the Goal. Items identifies the plural items that are tied together, resulting in their mutual attachment. Goal identifies the location to which the Item(s) is attached. Dependent_state identifies the state of the Item or Items which depends on the existence of the attachment. This role identifies the Manner in which an Item is in an attached state to a Goal, or two Items are attached to each other.

frame_definition: This frame concerns the inception of the life of a Child, generally human, at a particular Time and Place.
role_definitions: Child identifies the new self-motile creature. This role identifies the Time when the birth occurs, generally expressed as a date or a year. The location where the Child enters the world. The individuals that the Child is related to, including the male and female individuals that come together to produce a Child (the parents), as well those who are related to them by birth or marriage. The state of the Child as it enters the world. The way in which the Child leaves the womb; this role is typically only filled by phrases such as by natural birth or by Caesarian.

frame_definition: A Controlling_entity has control of a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
role_definitions: A thing or person whose behavior controls a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a Controlling_entity. A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a Controlling_entity. A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a Controlling_entity. The Degree to which the Controlling_entity effects the Dependent_entity. The Time at which the controlling occurs. The location at which the controlling occurs. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Controlling_entity that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

frame_definition: A Device or machine is in (or out of) service.
role_definitions: The Device or machine that is in or out of operation. The Time when a Device is in or out of operation. The Place in which the Device is or is not operating. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end.

frame_definition: A Theme is in a stable position with respect to a Location.
role_definitions: An entity which is at a particular Location The location (generally presumed to be known to the interlocutor) with respect to which the location of the Theme can be understood. A state (of the Theme) that results as a consequence of the Theme being situated at the Location. The time at which the Theme is at the Location. A salient entity that the Theme is located with respect to. This frame element is used to denote phrases that specifically entail an entity which is conceived as moving relative to another entity. A Depictive expression describes a state or condition of the Theme independent of its location.

frame_definition: An Assailant, a group of armed forces, surrounds the Victim, a military location and the people within it, in an attempt to cut the Victim off from the outside, with the goal of either forcing their surrender or weakening them so that an invasion would be successful.
role_definitions: The Assailant is a group of armed forces (or, metonymically, their commander or the organization they represent) that encircles, surrounds, or otherwise cuts off the Beseiged in an attempt to force surrender. The Victim is the fortification or geopolitical entity that is being attacked. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault. This role identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim. The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. This role identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim. An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels. The length of time that the Victim is under attack from the Assailant

frame_definition: The Borrower takes possession of a Theme with the knowledge that the Borrower will have to give the Theme back to the Lender after a Duration of time.
role_definitions: The person who receives the Theme from the Lender for a Duration. The amount of time for which the Borrower has possession of the Theme. The person or institution who gives the Theme to the Borrower for a Duration. The object that the Borrower receives from the Lender for a Duration. The aim of the Borrower which they believe will be accomplished by possessing the Theme. When the borrowing even occurs. The means by which the transfer of the Theme took place. The location in which the Borrower gets the Theme from the Lender. The way in which the Borrower gains possession of the Theme from the Lender.

frame_definition: An Agent brings about the end of a Theme's captivity at a Location_of_confinement in contravention of the plans or desires of a captor.
role_definitions: The Agent is the individual who ends the confinement or captivity of the Theme. The Theme is the person or object in motion released by the Agent. Any description of the release which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The action of the Agent which brings about the release. The Explanation identifies the reason for which the Agent releases the Theme. The Purpose identifies the purpose for which the Agent release the Theme. The location where the Theme ceases to be confined. The Time identifies when the Agent release the Theme . The location to which the Theme's motion was formerly inhibited. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. The state of the world when the Releasing event occurs.

frame_definition: This frame describes assembly or construction actions, where an Agent joins Components together to form a Created_entity, which is profiled, and hence the object of the verb.
role_definitions: The Agent builds a Created_entity. This role identifies the Instrument(s) with which an Agent builds a Created_entity. This role identifies the Place where the building occurs. This role identifies the Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. This role identifies the Time when the building occurs. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent builds a Created_entity. This role identifies the Components that form the Created_entity. Created_entity identifies the entity that is created in the act of building. This role identifies the Result of the act of building. Depictive identifes the phrase describing the participant in the act of building. This role idenitifies the Manner in which an Agent builds a Created_entity. This extrathematic role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. A characteristic of the Created_entity. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause places a Theme under a surface (often the ground) into a Goal location.
role_definitions: The Agent intentionally buries the Theme. The Theme is the object that is buried. The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it is buried. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path. The role Goal is the location where the Theme ends up. Any expression which describes a property of the placing action which is not directly related to the trajectory of the Theme's motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. The Degree indicates the degree to which the burying occurs. This role identifies any Depictive phrase describing the Agent or Theme. The Means is an act whereby the Agent achieves the burying of the Theme. This role identifies the Result of the burying. The Duration is the amount of time for which the Theme stays in the Goal location. The Place indicates where the burying occurs. The Explanation that the Theme is buried. Time is when the burying occurs The Area is the general area where the Theme is buried. The Cotheme is buried along with the Theme This role is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion of the theme into the ground. The Speed is the rate at which buring occurs. A non-animate force which buries the Theme. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by performing the burying action. The Beneficiary derives a benefit from the occurrence of the burying event.

frame_definition: A Cause causes an Effect.
role_definitions: A force, process, or event that produces an effect. Agents in a joint or reciprocal action (e.g. exchange) A positive or negative evaluation of the Phenomenon. Where the event takes place. This role identifies the Time when the event occurs. An entity which participates in a Cause, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. Any holistic description of the event, including overall depictions (the same way) and descriptions pertaining to the Actor's influence on the character of the event (eagerly, quietly). The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. An action through which the Actor or Cause accomplishes the action indicated by the target. How often the action denoted by the target occurs. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause causes an Entity to change, either in its category membership or in terms of the value of an Attribute.
role_definitions: The sentient entity that effects a change in the Entity. The category of which the Entity is a member before the Agent causes a change. The category that the Entity belongs to after it has undergone the change. The value that the Attribute assumes as a result of the change that the Entity is caused to undergo. The value that the Attribute has before the change takes place. The time at which the change of the Entity is caused. The extent to which the initial and final categories or values differ from each other. Any description of the event causing the change of the Entity which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in bringing about the change in the Entity. A characteristic of the Entity for which a value can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement , or observation. The abstract or concrete thing or situation that the Agent causes to change. An event that causes a change in the Entity. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by effecting a change in the Entity. An intentional action performed by the Agent (or event resulting from the Cause) that produces a change in the Entity. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The location where the change of the Entity is caused. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The particular role that the Agent plays in the Cause_change event. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame.

frame_definition: This frame consists of words that indicate that an Agent or a Cause affects the position of an Item on some scale (the Attribute) to change it from an initial value (Value_1) to an end value (Value_2).
role_definitions: The person who causes an entity (Item) to change its positon on a scale with respect to some property (Variable). The distance between the orginial value (Value-1) and the final value (Value-2) of the entity on the scale (Variable). The scale along which the Item ranges in value. The initial value of the entity (Item) along the scale. The final position on the scale that the entity (Item) assumes. The Co-Variable is the scale that the (dependent ) Variable is measured against. Any expression that says something about the movement of the entity (Item) along the scale between its initial (Value-1) and its final position (Value-2). The rate at which the entity's positon on the scale changes. The entity whose position along a scale is being changed. An act performed by the Agent that brings about the change in the position of the Item on the scale. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. When the event occurs. The force that causes the change. Any description of the Agent changing the value of an Attribute which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The location where the Agent changes the value of an Attribute.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Patient to be more strong, often resulting in something that is more secure and safe.
role_definitions: The Agent fortifies the Patient. The Patient is the entity that is being made stronger. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action The resultant state of the action. An act performed by an Agent that enables them to act upon the Patient. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The time at which the Agent makes the Patient stronger. The location at which the Agent fortifies the Patient. An event which causes the Patient to become stronger. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. The Circumstances of the world at the time of the event (which do not bear directly on the event itself).

frame_definition: An Agent acts to cause a Experiencer to feel a certain emotion.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person who's action's cause an emotion in the Experiencer. The Experiencer feels an emotion as caused by the Agent. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. The tool used by the Agent to cause an emotion in the Experiencer. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. An act performed by an Agent that enables them to act upon the Experiencer. In what way the Agent causes an emotion in the Experiencer. This role describes the event as a whole, often as a VPing. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. This role describes the reason for the state of affairs described by the target. For how long instances of an Agent causing the Patient an emotion has repeatedly occured. When the Agent causes emotion in the Experiencer. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The Event is the occasion or happening that evokes emotions in the Experiencer. This Event occurs as the direct result of a sentient being's actions. Type designates the kind of emotion that the Agent causes the Experiencer to have. Medium is the physical or abstract setting in which the Agent causes the Experiencer to feel an emotion. The location where the Agent causes the Experiencer to feel the emotion.

frame_definition: An Agent or a Cause causes a Fluid to move from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.
role_definitions: The animate protagonist who causes the Fluid to move. An event or force that causes the Fluid to move. The entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way. It is not necessarily in a liquid state but is construed that way. The location that the Fluid occupies initially. Goal is the location the Fluid ends up in as a result of the motion The trajectory along which the Fluid moves, exclusive of the Source and Goal. The setting in which the Fluid's movement takes place along an unspecified Path. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Time when the fluidic motion event is caused. A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in causing the Fluid to move. A state of the Fluid that results from the motion event. The location where the motion takes place. The entity manipulated by the Agent which causes the Fluid to move. An action of the Agent which brings about the motion of the Fluid. The state-of-affairs that the Agent is attempting to bring about by causing motion. The distance travelled by the Fluid.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe situations in which an Agent or a Cause injures a Victim.
role_definitions: Agent is the person causing the Victim's injury. The Victim is the being or entity that is injured. If the Victim is included in the phrase indicating Body_part, the Victim role is tagged on a second role layer (see 3rd example). Result identifies the result of the Agent's action. Degree is the degree to which the Agent causes harm to the Victim. The Manner in which the Agent acts upon the Victim. An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. Place identifies the place where the harm causing event occurs. Time identifies the time when the harm-causing event occurs. The Body_part identifies the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place. This role is any object used to cause the injury. Purpose identifies the purpose for which a harm-causing action is carried out. Depictive identifies any Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action. This role identifies the event in which the harm is caused. A fact or action somehow related to the Victim that the Agent responds to by causing harm to the Victim. Iterations refers to the number of times the Agent causes harm to the Victim. The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that inflicts harm on the Victim The Subregion_bodypart defines the precise location on the Body_part which is harmed. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Cause_harm event and any of its participants. How often the Cause_harm event occurs. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of the Cause_harm event to its end. This role indicates that the Cause_harm event is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the Cause_harm event) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. A description of the harm event which significantly displays a different aspect. The length of time from when the Cause_harm event began to be repeated to when it stopped.

frame_definition: An Agent causes an Impactor to make sudden, forcible contact with an Impactee, or manipulates two (or more)
role_definitions: The Force is the amount of force in the course of the impact. The Impactee is the entity which is hit by the Impactor. The Impactor is the entity that hits the Impactee because of the Agent's efforts. The Impactors are the multiple entities that collide. The role Manner identifies the manner in which an Agent intentionally affects a Impactee. Where the event takes place. This role identifies the Result of the impact. This role indicates the Speed of the Impactor (or Impactors at impact. Subregion identifies the part of the larger whole which was hit. This role identifies the Time when the impact occurs. The Agent causes an impact. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent intentionally affects an Impactee. The role Means identifies the means by which an Agent intentionally affects a Impactee. The role Purpose identifies the purpose for which an Agent intentionally affects the Impactee. This role identifies the Period_of_iterations during which the Agent repeatedly causes impacts. The Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that causes an Impactor to make sudden, forcible contact with an Impactee.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Theme to move from a Source, along a Path, to a Goal.
role_definitions: The Agent is the one whose action causes the motion of a Theme. The Agent is generally realized as the External Argument. The role Theme is generally an NP Object. The role Source is the starting point of motion. The role Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor Goal. The role Goal is the point at which the Theme ends up as a result of the motion. The role Distance is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the Theme. The role Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element. The state of a participant during the action Degree to which event occurs The role Means indicates the action that is taken that results in the motion of the Theme The role Manner is any expression which describes a property of the motion of the Theme which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and other things count as Manner expressions. Subregion identifies the part of the Theme that makes contact with the resulting location. When Subregion is expressed, there usually is no Goal expressed. Cause marks expressions that indicate some non-intentional, typically non-human, force that causes the Theme to be set in motion. An entity saliently involved in the transmission of force from an Agent to a Theme. It may be the Agent's bodypart, or some kind of device. The Place is the general area that provides a setting for a specific motion (with Source, Path, or Goal). The time at which the motion of the Theme occurs. A resultant state that the Theme is in at the end of its motion. The Agent's manipulation of the Theme may be further specified as being localized to some part of the Theme, a Handle. The Handle is usually expressed as a PP A previous state that the Theme was in before the beginning of its motion. This role denotes a proposition from which the main clause logically follows. The amount of time that the action requires.

frame_definition: These words refer to an Agent joining Parts to form a Whole.
role_definitions: In causative uses of these verbs there is an Agent responsible for amalgamating the Parts. The Agent is generally the External Argument (or the object of a PP-by in passives). This role identifies Whole as the entity resulting from combination of Parts. When overtly expressed, it is usually a PP Complement (often headed by into). This role identifies the Parts entities being combined, and is often expressed in a single plural NP, usually the direct object of a verb. This role identifies the first of two Parts mentioned. It is most often the NP-Object of a verb. This role identifies the second of two Parts mentioned. It is usually a PP Complement. This role identifies the Manner in which the amalgamating occurs. This role identifies the thoroughness of the mixing job, i.e. to what degree the resulting Whole is undifferentiated. This role identifies the Means by which the amalgamating occurs. This role is used for indicating the Result of amalgamating. The state of the Parts during the amalgamation. Often it refers to the proportion of the Parts to one another. The state of affairs that the Agent seeks to bring about by the Amalgamation. The location that the event occurs. The time at which the amalgamation occurs.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Dryee (either a surface or an entire entity, inside and out) to become dry.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the Dryee to become dry. The Dryee is the entity which has the water removed from it. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent intentionally affects the Dryee. This role identifies the Manner in which an the Agent dries the Dryee. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent intentionally affects the Dryee. This role identifies the Place where the Agent intentionally affects the Dryee. This role identifies the Purpose for which Agent intentionally affects the Dryee and what the Agent hopes to accomplish. This role identifies the Time when the Agent intentionally affects the Dryee. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of dryness. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. The Subregion describes which part of a larger whole is being affected. This role identifies the length of Time that the drying takes. This role identifies the Temperature at which heat is applied to the Dryee. The degree to which the Dryee ends up dry.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause makes a New_member part of Group.
role_definitions: The Agent is a volitional animate being who causes the New_member to become part of the Group. Something that is already a member of the Group and represents the Group as a whole. An item that becomes a part of the Group. The Group is anything that can be conceptualized as a complex collection of parts or ingredients, including through metonymy like containers or locations, which New_members can join. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that is responsible for causing a New_member to enter a Group. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the inclusion of a New_member. This role identifies when the inclusion of the New_member to the Group occurs. The manner in which the Agent acts. This role identifies what the Agent hopes to accomplish by including a New_member to a Group. The location in which a New_member is entered into a pre-existing Group.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause makes a Patient sharper or duller.
role_definitions: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the sharpening (or dulling) action. The Agent causes the Patient to become more or less sharp. An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with an Patient, causing it to change in sharpness. This role identifies the place where the Agent sharpens the Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which the Agent sharpens the Patient. This role identifies the time when the Agent sharpens Patient. The Patient is the entity that is sharpened. The manner in which the Agent changes the sharpness of the Patient. The state of affairs that the Agent is responding to by executing the sharpening act. The extent to which the Patient's sharpness is affected by the Agent. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of sharpness. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. The resulting configuration of the Patient.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Patient to be wet with a Liquid.
role_definitions: The Agent is a volitional animate being who causes the Patient to become wet. The Liquid is a fluid or gas that permeates or covers the Patient. It most frequently occurs in a PP Complement headed by with. The Patient takes up the Liquid through its pores or has the Liquid covering its surface. This role identifies the Manner or way in which the Agent wets the Patient. This role identifies the Means by which an the Agent wets the Patient This role identifies the Place where the Agent wets the Patient. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Agent wets the Patient and what the Agent hopes to accomplish. This role identifies the Time when the Agent wets the Patient. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent intentionally wets the Patient. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces the state of wetness. Degree to which the Agent wets the Patient. The Subregion describes which part of a larger whole is being affected. This role describes the reason for the state of the Cause_to_be_wet event.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to continue. '
role_definitions: The individual who causes the Process to continue or the State to be maintained. A Process that is maintained by the Agent or Cause. The State that is maintained by the Agent or Cause. The length of time for which the Agent maintain the State or Process. The event by which an Agent or Cause maintains the State or Process.
