An event that causes the Process or State to be maintained. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by maintaining the State or Process. An entity directed by the Agent that maintain the State or Process. The time at which the Process continues. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The location at which the Process continues.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause causes a Process or State to end.
role_definitions: A Process which is ended by the Agent or Cause. An action of the Agent that causes the Process or State to end. The location where the Process or State is caused to end. The Explanation for why the Process or State is ended. The Time when the Process or State is ended. The Degree to which the Process or State is brought to an end. Depictive phrase describing the actor of the event that causes the Process or State to end. The Manner of causing the Process or State to end. The individual who causes the Process or State to end. An event that causes the Process or State to end. A State which is ended by the Agent or Cause.

frame_definition: An Agent intentionally seeks to bring about an internal mental or emotional state in the Experiencer.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Means by which the Agent intentionally tries to bring about an internal mental or emotional state. The Agent is an External Argument of the target word and purposefully arouses an emotional state. The Experiencer is the person the Agent causes to have a particular emotional state. This Frame Element is for expressions that elaborate the manner in which the Agent affects the Experiencer. What the Agent intends to make the Experiencer do by causing a certain experience and the Experiencer actually does. This role identifies the Time when the Agent affects the Experiencer. This role identifies the Place where the Agent affects the Experiencer This role identifies the Instrument with which the Agent brings about the emotional state. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent brings about the emotional state in the Experiencer. Degree to which the Experiencer ends up feeling an emotion.

frame_definition: An Agent suddenly and often violently separates the Whole_patient into two or more smaller Pieces, resulting in the Whole_patient no longer existing as such.
role_definitions: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the Whole_patient being broken into Pieces. An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with a Whole_patient to accomplish its fracture. Any description of the fracturing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the breakage. The entity which is destroyed by the Agent and that ends up broken into Pieces. This role identifies the place where the Agent breaks the Whole_patient into pieces. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent causes the break-up of the Whole_patient. A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action. This role identifies the time when the Agent breaks up the Whole_patient. The fragments of the Whole_patient that result from the Agent's action. The degree to which the fracturing is completed. The part of the Whole_patient which is directly affected by the breakage. This role identifies the Result of an event. The Resistant_surface is the surface against which a Agent presses the Whole_patient. An event which leads to the fragmentation of the Whole_patient.

frame_definition: An Agent manipulates a Sound_maker or a Cause causes the Sound_maker to emit a sound.
role_definitions: The individual that manipulates a Sound_maker so that it makes Noise. The entity that produces the Noise, as a result of the action of the Agent. The Subregion is the sublocation of the Sound_maker from which the sound is emitting. The location from which an Agent or Cause acts to project sound from a Sound_maker toward an (implicit) perceiver. The state of one of the primary participants (either Agent or Sound_maker) during the course of the sound-making event. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An action directly due to the Agent or Cause that results in the Sound_maker emitting noise.. The inanimate force of nature that causes the Sound_maker to produce noise. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. The state-of-affairs or action that the Agent wishes to bring about by performing the action. The time at which the noise is produced. The location at which the sound is produced. The number of times the Sound_maker makes noise per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. Used for expressions that indicate the number of times Sound_maker makes noise.

frame_definition: An Agent works on a Project so that it reaches a more advanced and desirable state.
role_definitions: The object or idea that undergoes change due to the efforts of the Agent. The former state of the Project. The state of the Project following an advance. The time at which the progress occurs. The rate at which the change happens. A description of the progress, generally a description comparing events (the same way); in addition, it may describe characteristics and states of the Agent that also affect the development. The period over which the Agent develops the Project. The amount of advancement that the Project has attained. The relevant dimension of development. The individual that brings about the development of the Project. The location at which the the Project progresses. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Agent progresses the Project. The action of the Agent which enables the advancement.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Theme to move with respect to a certain Fixed_location, generally with a certain Periodicity, without undergoing unbounded translational motion or significant alteration of configuration/shape. '
role_definitions: Theme identifies the object involved in motion. This role identifies the Place where the event occurs. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. This role identifies the Explanation for which an event occurs. This role identifies the Time when the event occurs. Manner of performing an action The Means is the way in which the motion in place is instigated. Degree to which event occurs The number of times the Theme returns to a state in a given duration. The point or set of points that define the limits of motion for the Theme. For spinning motions, it is the axis, for vibrating it is a boundary, for swinging it is a point. The Agent performs the intentional act. This role identifies the Instrument with which an intentional act is performed. This role identifies the Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. Angle identifies the amount that the Theme turns. The Agent's manipulation of an Theme may be further specified as being localized to some part of the Theme, a Locus. This role is usually expressed as a PP Complement. This role identifies the part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the Theme. Cause identifies the non-agentive force that causes the motion in place. This frame element is used for all path-like expressions, that express the Direction of the swinging, vibrating or rotating. This role identifies the Result of an event.

frame_definition: An Agent acts so as to cause some process to begin again after an interruption or suspension.
role_definitions: A sentient being acts with the intention of causing a process to begin again. The process which begins again after a suspension. The period of time during which the process is suspended. The time at which the process is restarted. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that causes the process to resume. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. The location where the Agent causes the Process to resume. The intentional act performed by the Agent that results in the resumption of the Process. A description of the manner in which the Agent causes the resumption of the Process. The length of time for which the Process continues after being started by the Agent.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause causes a Sleeper to transition from the Sleep_state to wakeful consciousness.
role_definitions: Where the event takes place. The person or being that is sleeping. When the event occurs. The Agent is the person performing the intentional act. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent intentionally affects a Patient. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent intentionally affects a Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent wakes the Sleeper. This role identifies the Explanation for which an intentional act is performed. Mary woke him because he looked troubled. An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. This describes the state out of which the Sleeper is awakened. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The degree to which the Sleeper ends up awake.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Useful_location to become accessible (or non-accessible) to a Theme to a certain Degree.
role_definitions: The Agent blocks access to the Useful_location. The Useful_location is the place the Theme is headed towards and the Agent has changed the accessibility of. The Theme is headed towards, or has an intention or tendency to head towards, the Useful_location, but is potentially blocked due to actions of the Agent. The degree to which the Useful_location is or is not accessible. The Agent may regulate access to the Useful_location by regulating access to a Portal, including a part of the portal that could block potential Themes, such as doors or gates. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An action carried out by the Agent to bring about the change in accessibility. The Time when the Agent changes the accessibility of the Useful_location. The general Place where the blocking or allowing of access occurs. The Purpose for which the Agent changes the accessibility of the Useful_location. A portion of the Useful_location, usually its edge, where accessibility is blocked. The Agent uses the Instrument to block access, often by placing the Instrument such that it cannot be traversed.

frame_definition: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the duration of an Event.
role_definitions: The sentient entity that changes the duration of the Event. The new duration of the Event. The planned duration of the Event before the change takes place. The time at which the change in duration of the Event is caused. The extent to which the initial and final durations differ from each other. Any description of the event causing the change of the Event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in bringing about the change of duration. The Event's duration is changed. An event that causes the change in Event duration. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by changing the duration of the Event. An intentional action performed by the Agent (or event resulting from the Cause) that produces a change in the Event's duration.

frame_definition: In this frame, an Agent or Cause changes the timing of an Event.
role_definitions: The Agent is the animate entity which brings about the change in time of the Event. The Cause is the non-sentient force which brings about the change of time for the Event. The Event is the occurrence which changes time. The Manner is the way in which the time change takes place. The Means describe the way in which the time change is accomplished. The Degree is the extent to which the time change takes place. The Destination_event is the occasion which the timing of the Event occurs with respect to. The Destination_time is the time at which the Event actually occurs. The Interval between the Landmark_time and the Destination_time may be expressed. The Landmark_time is when the Event was originally intended to take place. The Explanation is the reason or explanation for why the Event occurs at a different time. The state-of-affairs that the Agent intends to bring about by changing the time the Event will take place. The time at which the delay occurred. The location at which the expected time of the Event changes.

frame_definition: In this frame a Patient changes its consistency.
role_definitions: This role indicates the Result of the change of consistency of the Patient This is the original state of the Patient. Patient is the entity that undergoes a change. Where the the Patient changes consistency. When the Patient changes consistency. The Explanation for which the Patient changes consistency. The Speed at which the change of consistency occurs. This role identifies the Circumstances at which the consistency change occurs. The Manner in which the Patient changes consistency. Degree to which the Patient changes consistency. The Subregion describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.

frame_definition: This frame concerns the appointment of a New_leader or removal from office of an Old_leader.
role_definitions: The Selector (most commonly a group of people) is responsible for a change in leadership. Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs. With words denoting removal (or attempted removal) from office of a leader, the Old_leader is typically the direct object of verbs, or occurs in a PP Complement with noun targets, frequently headed by the preposition against. With words denoting appointment to a position, the New_leader is typically the object of verbs. Frequently the Old_leader or New_leader is referred to only by his/her role. However, the Role can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement. The role Old_order identifies the political order that existed before the change of leadership occurs. This role indicates the Degree to which an event occurs. Depictive indicates the state of one of the participants during the action. This role is used for the Manner of performing an action. This role identifies the Means by which the Selector accomplishes the change of leadership. This role is used for indicating the Result of an event. This frame element describes the situation that brought about the change of leadership. The Function is the purpose the New_leader will fufill. When the change takes place. Where the change takes place. A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function of governance.

frame_definition: In this frame, the temperature of an Item changes.
role_definitions: The entity whose temperature changes. The temperature that the Item has prior to the event. The temperature of the Item after the event. The amount of difference between the Initial_temperature and the Final_temperature of the Item. The Hot_cold_source is the source of the heat or coolness An event or state-of-affairs that leads to the change in temperature of the Item. This role identifies the Container that holds the Item whose temperature is being changed. The state of the Item during the temperature change. The span of time in which the Item is changing temperature. The time at which the change in temperature occurs. The location at which the Item changes temperature. A portion of the Item which is affected by the temperature change. The manner in which the Item changes temperature. This role identifies the Circumstances under which the temperature change occurs The state of the Item that results from the temperature change. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. The scalar property that the Item possesses. This role is rarely expressed. The degree to which the change in temperature takes place.

frame_definition: A Device or machine is put in (or out of) service either by a volitional Agent or by a Cause event or force acting on the Device.
role_definitions: The Device or machine that is in or out of operation. The Time when a Device is put into or out of operation. The Place in which the Device is put into or out of operation. The Agent is the person who changes the operational state of the Device. Cause identifies the non-agentive force that causes the Device to begin to operate. The role Purpose denotes a state of affairs that the Agent wants to bring about by putting the Device into operation. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the event of the Device's being caused to operate or cease to operate logically follows. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The degree to which the Device is active after the action. An action done by the Agent in order to cause the Device to being to operate.

frame_definition: This frame consists of words that indicate the change of an Item's position on a scale (the Attribute) from a starting point (Initial_value) to an end point (Final_value).
role_definitions: The Attribute is a scalar property that the Item possesses. The entity that has a position on the scale. The distance by which an Item changes its position on the scale. Any expression that gives information about points on the scale that the Item traverses between the starting and ending point of its movement along the scale. The position on the scale where the Item ends up. The initial position on the scale from which the Item moves away. The rate of change of the Value. The Correlated_variable is an ordered progression of positions or values (most often a sequence of spatial locations) that the (dependent) Attribute is measured against. The Correlated_variable is metaphorically mapped onto the progression of time, and in the absence of this FE, changes are simply measured against (forward-directional) time. Manner of performing an action Degree to which event occurs The Circumstances under which the change of position takes place. Result. of an event The Group in which an Item changes the value of a Attribute in a specified way. The Time is the time-frame in which the change of position occurs. The length of time over which the change takes place. A portion of the scale, typically identified by its end points, along which the values of the Attribute fluctuate. The value, location, or state-of-affairs that corresponds to the Initial_value of the Attribute. The value, location, or state-of-affairs that corresponds to the Final_value of the Attribute. A location where Attribute is measured A description that presents the Item's state before the change in the Attribute's value as an independent predication. A description that presents the Item's state after the change in the Attribute's value as an independent predication. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the quantity change takes place and of which it is taken to be a part. The situation or state-of-affairs that results in the change in quantity described in this instance of the frame.

frame_definition: A Protagonist changes the overall position and posture of the body.
role_definitions: Any description of the change in posture which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a Protagonist that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The individual whose posture changes. The Protagonist's state throughout the time they are changing posture. The place or setting in which the Protagonist's change of posture takes place. The Time at which the Protagonist changes posture. The final state of the Protagonist after the change of posture. Path is used for expressions that indicate the trajectory of motion without referring to the Source or the Goal of motion. This role is used for any expressions that indicate the endpoint of the posture change. Often this is the place that provides support for the posture. Source is used for expressions that indicate the starting point of the change of posture. This role is used for expressions that indicate a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the Goal of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body. Often Direction is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Protagonist, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer. The Purpose for which a Protagonist assumes a posture. This role is used for expressions that indicate the extent to which the body (part) moves during the change of posture. The part of the body that provides support to the Protagonist in holding the posture. An action of the Protagonist whereby they achieve the change of posture.

frame_definition: The lexical units in this frame have to do with an Entity being in a State of order or disorder.
role_definitions: The object or phenomenon which exists in the State of disorder. It is common for the Entity to be null instantiated in this frame. The State in which the Entity exists. Usually the State will be the target-denoting noun. The degree to which the State exists. The location where the Entity exists in the State. The amount of time in which the Entity exists in the State The time at which the Entity exists in the State. Any characterization of the State not covered by a more specific frame element.

frame_definition: A Cognizer decides upon the Chosen (either an item or a course of action) out of a set of Possibilities .
role_definitions: Depictive labels an independent descriptor of a Cognizer in a choosing event. The Cognizer chooses the Chosen out of the Possibilities. Chosen identifies the entity or course of action which is selected from among the Possibilities. This role identifies the Explanation for which the Cognizer chooses the Chosen. A Cognizer makes a choice from among a set of Possibilities. Possibilities are commonly expressed via an oblique phrase which indicates the alternative or alternatives, or by a subordinate clause (choosing to do it or choosing not to do it), typically headed by 'whether or 'if'. This role identifies the Means by which bthe Cognizer accomplishes the choosing. This role identifies the Place where the choosing occurs. This role identifies the Larger_purpose for which the Cognizer chooses. It exemplifies what the Cognizer hopes to accomplish by choosing the particular Chosen. This role identifies the Time when the Cognizer chooses the Chosen. Any description of the selecting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a Cognizer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Topic occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun target: The Cognizer intends the Chosen to fulfill an Inherent_purpose . The hypothetical Chosen that is less desirable for the Cognizer.

frame_definition: An Executive_authority exercises their power to reduce or remove negative consequences for someone who has been labeled an Offender who participated in an Crime.
role_definitions: The individual who is accused or convicted of a Crime. An action deemed criminal by law. The constitutionally specified authority who has the power to grant clemency. A state of affairs that the Executive_authority is responding to in granting clemency. The time at which clemency is granted. An intentional action performed by the Executive_authority that accomplishes the granting of clemency. Any description of the act of clemency which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of an Executive_authority that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An action that the Executive_authority intends to accomplish by granting clemency. The location at which the Executive_authority grants clemency.

frame_definition: A State_of_affairs (a state or event) either holds or occurs, and is presented as being causally independent of other (implicit) states or events that might otherwise have been expected to be causally related to the State_of_affairs.
role_definitions: A State_of_affairs (that is, an event or state) that holds independently of (potentially) causally-related States of affairs. The Time at which the State_of_affairs holds. The Place where the State_of_affairs holds. Any description of the target word not covered by a more specific FE.

frame_definition: Partner_1 and Partner_2 or a group of Partners work together in some Undertaking.
role_definitions: When the parties in a collaboration are expressed separately, this Frame Element marks constituents that express the one that is grammatically more prominent, i.e., the one that is the subject of an active clause. This Frame element marks constituents expressing the grammatically less prominent, typically oblique, party in a collaboration. This frame element marks constituents that express the project in which the Partners are collaborating. This role identifies the Manner in which Partner_1 collaborates with Partner_2 or in which the Partners collaborate. This frame element marks expressions that express the parties that work together in an Undertaking. This role identifies the time when the Partners are engaged in their collaboration. This role identifies the Place where the collaboration occurs. This role identifies the amount of time the Partners collaborate. This role marks expressions that indicate to what extent the Partners are cooperating. The action taken by the Partners that lets them accomplish the collaboration.

frame_definition: A Protagonist comes to suffer from a Disease, often implicitly acquired from a Source.
role_definitions: The individual or environmental reservoir of a Disease that the Protagonist was exposed to. The time at which the Protagonist contracts the Disease. The location at which the Protagonist contracts the Disease. It is different from the Source (usually marked with 'from') in that it does not necessarily mean that it was contact with the Place that actually led to infection. Any description of the event as a whole in comparison to other events ('the same way') or in terms of details of the event that affect the overall event ('rapidly').

frame_definition: In this frame a group of Individuals meet to form a Configuration.
role_definitions: The Individuals are self-movers who come together. The Configuration describes the resulting formation of the individuals. The Means descibes the way in which the Individuals accomplish the congregating. The Place is where the congregating occurs. The Time is when the congregating occurs. An action that the Configuration plans to engage in upon assembly. The position in a series of iterations that the current congregating event occupies . How often the Individuals come together to form an Configuration. Any description of congregating which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Individuals or Configuration that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A Topic of a discussion that may occur between the Individuals. Party_1 is the grammatically more prominent participant in the congregating event. A grammatically less prominent participant in the congregating event. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.

frame_definition: An Entity comes into existence at a particular Place and Time which may take a certain Duration_of_endstate, have a Cause, or be formed from Components.
role_definitions: Concrete or abstract entity that did not exist before the Time of the event. This is the Place where the new Entity comes into being. This role identifes the Time when a new Entity comes into existence. This role labels the Explanation of the formation of the Entity. This role identifies the components out of which the Entity forms. This role identifies the length of time that the Entity exists after coming to be. The form in which the Entity comes to be. This role identifies the Period_of_iterations during which habitual or iterative actions are performed. The way in which the Entity comes to be.

frame_definition: These are words describing a basic commercial transaction involving a Buyer and a Seller exchanging Money and Goods, taking the perspective of the Buyer.
role_definitions: The Buyer wants the Goods and offers Money to a Seller in exchange for them. The role Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. Where the event takes place. The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. The Explanation for which an event occurs. When the event occurs. Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Buyer that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The individual intended by the Buyer to receive the Goods. The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped. The Buyer's intended purpose for the Goods.

frame_definition: This frame involves Buyers paying Money for Goods.
role_definitions: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods. The role Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Abby bought the car with cash. Robin paid for the car by check. Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. The Seller has the Goods and wants the Money. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. Where the event takes place. The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. The Explanation for which an event occurs. When the event occurs. Any description of the paying event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Buyer that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.

frame_definition: These are words describing basic commercial transactions involving a buyer and a seller exchanging money and goods, taking the perspective of the seller.
role_definitions: The Buyer has the Money and wants the Goods. The role Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. The Means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. The Seller has possession of the Goods and exchanges them for Money from a Buyer. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. Where the event takes place. The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. The Explanation for which an event occurs. When the event occurs. Any description of the selling event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Seller that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The state of the Seller after the sale has occurred. The length of time from when the commerce event began to be repeated to when it stopped. The Buyer's intended purpose for the Goods. This role indicates that the selling act reverses an earlier separate act in which the current Seller bought the Goods from the current Buyer. This role indicates that the selling act constitues a re-selling by the current Seller of Goods that they bought earlier from a third person who is not the Buyer of the current selling act.

frame_definition: A Perpetrator (generally intentionally) commits a Crime, i.e. does something not permitted by the laws of society.
role_definitions: The individual that commits a Crime. An act, generally intentional, that has been formally forbidden by law. The action that the Perpetrator was trying to accomplish in the Crime. A description of secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Perpetrator that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An action performed by the Perpetrator in order to accomplish the Crime. A state of affairs that the Perpetrator is responding to in their Crime. When the Crime was committed. The location where the Crime occurs. The Instrument used in committing the crime. The frequency with which a Crime is committed.

frame_definition: A Communicator conveys a Message to an Addressee; the Topic and Medium of the communication also may be expressed.
role_definitions: The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a Message to the Addressee. The Addressee receives a Message from the Communicator. Message is a proposition or set of propositions that the Communicator wants the Addressee to believe or take for granted. The Topic is the subject matter to which the Message pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object. The physical or abstract setting in which the Message is conveyed. The amount of information exchanged when communication occurs. The Depictive describes the state of the Communicator. The Manner in which the Communicator communicates. The Means by which the Communicator communicates. The time at which the communication takes place. Duration is the length of time during which the communication takes place. This role describes the number of times per unit of time that the Communicator conveys a Message. The location where the act of communication occurs. The Purpose for which a Communicator communicates. The Quote is the concrete record of a communication act.

frame_definition: This frame contains words for types of noise which can be used to characterize verbal communication.
role_definitions: Speaker is the sentient entity that delivers the Message. The Addressee refers to the one toward whom the Communication_noise is directed. Addressee generally occurs in to or at PPs. Message has a number of different realizations in this frame, including that-clauses, direct quotes, infinitival complements, for-to phrases, and NP Objects. Topic occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by about. Medium is used for a physical entity or channel that transmits the Message. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by on or in. This role identifies the state of the Speaker during the communication. Manner describes the manner or style in which the Communication_noise is delivered. The Communication_noise may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause, the Speaker's mental or emotional state. Internal_cause is expressed in a PP Complement. Degree to which event occurs The Means by which the Speaker communicates. The Voice describes the Speaker's utterance or other message-encoded production. This role identifies the Place where an event occurs. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. This role indicates that the communication act denoted by the target is in response to an earlier communication act in which the roles of Speaker and Addressee were reversed. This is conceptually akin to the Communication_response frame in which the targets themselves denote the responsive nature of the act. This role identifies the Time where the Communication noise event occurs.

frame_definition: This frame deals with a Speaker communicating a reply or response, a Message, to some prior communication or action, the Trigger. ''
role_definitions: The Speaker is the sentient entity that communicates the reply or response. It is expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of a Target verb or as the Genitive modifier of a Target noun: This is the person to whom the response is communicated. When expressed, this role occurs as the direct object of a Target verb, or in a prepositional phrase introduced by 'to': The Message is the role that identifies the content of what the Speaker is communicating to the Addressee. It can be expressed as a direct quote or a clause. Topic occurs quite rarely in this frame and usually only as a PP Complement of a noun Target: As with Medium in other Communication frames, the physical entity or channel used to communicate can be expressed, usually as a PP Complement headed by 'on' or 'in': The Trigger is the prior communication or action to which a response is given. It can occur as an NP Object or a PP Complement. Manner of performing an action Depictive phrase describing the Speaker. This role identifies the Means by the Speaker achieves the communication of the response Message . The response may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal_cause, the Agent's mental or emotional state. Internal_cause is expressed in a PP Complement: The location in which the Speaker makes a verbal response. The time interval during which the Speaker makes their verbal response. An action that the Speaker intends to accomplish by making a verbal response. The Duration of the communication response.

frame_definition: An Agent becomes involved in an Issue which has negative consequences for them.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Issue that the Agent deals with. The Agent is the person who is acting to deal with the Issue. This role identifies the Place where the intentional act occurs. This role identifies the reason why the Agent confronts the issue. This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally. This role identifies the way in which an Agent goes about facing the Issue. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Domain within which the Agent acts. The Frequency with which the Agent does the Act in a given period of time. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The Result describes the resulting outcome of the confronting act. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. This role gives a description of the confronting event as a whole.

frame_definition: A Communicator (whose Location may be indicated) directs a Communication to an Addressee at a particular Address.
role_definitions: The person who uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey a message to another person. The physical or abstract setting in which the message is conveyed. The person that receives the message from the Communicator. This role is used for a (metaphorical) place in a system of communication where Communicators and Addressees can access the system. The information that the Communicator wishes to impart to the Addressee, often to get a particular response. In this frame the Communication is not necessarily received by the Addressee. This role identifies the Purpose for the Communicator contacting the Addressee. Often, this role is used to identify a PP-for which indicates what the Communicator is attempting to obtain. This is the subject matter to which the message pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about'. The location occupied by the Communicator. This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs. This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally. The Intermediary is the person who facilitates the contact. The Depictive notes the state of one of the participants in the contacting event. The number of times a Communicator contacts the Addressee per unit of time. Any description of the nature of the action (e.g. 'the same way'), including especially internal states of the Communicator that also influence the way the action is carried out. An action of the Communicator that enables them to make contact.

frame_definition: A Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable.
role_definitions: A thing or person whose behavior controls a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by a Controlling_entity or an Controlling_situation. A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. A situation whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by a Controlling_entity, Controlling_situation, or Controlling_variable. A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of a Controlling_entity, a Controlling_situation, or a Controlling_variable. A situation whose temporal or other characteristics control a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. The Degree to which the Controlling element affects the Dependent element. The Time at which the controlling occurs. The location at which the controlling occurs. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Influencing_entity that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: This frame describes food and meal preparation.
role_definitions: The Cook prepares the Produced_food. The Produced_food is the result of a Cook's efforts. This role identifies the Heating_Instrument with which the Cook prepares the Food. This role identifes the Container that holds the food being produced. This role identifies the Place where the cooking creation occurs. This role identifies the Means by which the cooking creation is performed. This role identifies the Purpose for which the cooking creation is performed. Recipient identifies the person for whom the food has been prepared. This role identifies the Time when the cooking creation occurs. This role identifies the Degree to which an event occurs. This role identifies the Manner in which the cooking creation performed. This role identifies the Ingredients which are altered by the Cook to create the Produced_food.

frame_definition: Blend of Rewards_and_punishments and Bodily_injury in which the Agent performs some action intended to cause Bodily harm to the Evaluee as a consequence of some action or belief of the Evaluee (the Reason).
role_definitions: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act. The instrument with which an intentional act is performed. The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward. Where the event takes place. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. When the event occurs. Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object: Manner of performing an action Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a for-PP, e.g. Result of an event This role is the location on the body where the bodily injury takes place. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action Degree to which event occurs This frame element marks a quantity related to the seriousness of the punished behavior.

frame_definition: In this frame, the Patient, an inorganic item, undergoes a chemical process caused by another entity, which renders it less useful, desirable or stable.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Degree to which the Cause corrodes the Patient. This role identifies the Duration of time for which the Cause corrodes the Patient. This role identifies the Initial_state of the Patient. This role identifies the Place where the Cause corrodes the Patient. This role identifies the Explanation for which the Patient is corroded. This role identifies the Result of the caused corrosion. This role identifies the Time when the Cause corrodes the Patient. The Patient is corroded by the Cause. This role identifies the Speed at which the Cause corrodes the Patient. The Subregion identifies the part of a larger whole that is affected. This role identifies the Manner in which the Cause corrodes the Patient. This role identifies the Means by which the Cause corrodes the Patient. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Patient is corroded. Cause identifies an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that corrodes the Patient. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Cause. The individual that corrodes the Patient. The Agent may use an Instrument to cause the corrosion.

frame_definition: An Assailant physically attacks a Victim (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the Victim physical damage.
role_definitions: This role is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's attack. An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim. The person (or other self-directed entity) that is responding to a prior attack by attempting physical harm to the Victim. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault. This role identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim. A state of affairs that the Assailant is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim. The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describeing the state of the Assailant or Victim while the Attack occurs. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily. The Result of the attack on the Victim by the Assailant. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Examples include once, twice, [Cardinal expression] + times, a lot. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels.

frame_definition: A Creator creates an artifact that is typically an iconic Representation of an actual or imagined entity or event.
role_definitions: An individual or individuals that bring the Representation into existence. The time at which a Representation is created. The entity that is created to represent either iconically or abstractly. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Creator that also affect the action (deliberately, carefully). This role identifies a Role that one of the role fillers of the current frame also fills in a background context, either generically or in some specific instance. This role describes the Creator as being in some state during the creation of the Representation. The physical location that holds the Representation. An action that the Creator intends to accomplish by creating the Representation. The location in which the Creator produces the Representation. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the creation of the Representation ogically follows. The entity which the Creator uses to create the work of art. An action performed by the Creator which brings about the creation of the Representation. A characteristic of the Creator or the Representation. A representation of the entity depicted which the Creator uses as a reference in the creation of the Representation. For instance, another piece of art, a photograph, or his/her memory.

frame_definition: This frame deals with a Healer treating and curing an Affliction (the injuries, disease, or pain) of the Patient, sometimes also mentioning the use of a particular Treatment or Medication.
role_definitions: The Healer, anyone who treats or cures the Patient, occurs as the External Argument of verbs: This is the sufferer of the injury, disease or pain and can occur as an NP Object in this frame. However, Patient may not be expressed as a separate Frame Element but frequently occurs as the possessor of the Affliction, an example of role Conflation: (See section on Conflation.) The Frame Element Affliction is generally the NP Object of a verb, frequently incorporating the Patient as a possessor, as described above: The role Treatment is used for treatments and means, distinguished by separate FEs in FN-1. Degree to which event occurs Manner of performing an action The injested, applied, injected, etc. substance designed to cure the Patient. The Reason for which an intentional act is performed. Where the event takes place. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. When the event occurs. The Body_part is the specific area of the Patient's body which is treated. The period of time that the Patient recieves the Treatment.

frame_definition: An Agent cuts a Item into Pieces using an Instrument (which may or may not be expressed).
role_definitions: The Agent is the person cutting the Item into Pieces. The Instrument with which the Item is being cut into Pieces. Where the slicing takes place. The purpose for which the Item is being sliced into Pieces. When the slicing occurs. An act of the Agent that accomplishes the slicing. The item which is being cut into Pieces. The Result of the Item being sliced into Pieces. Manner in which the Item is being cut into Pieces. The Pieces are the parts of the original Item which are the result of the slicing.

frame_definition: An Agent affects a Patient in such a way that the Patient (or some Subregion of the Patient) ends up in a non-canonical state.
role_definitions: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the damage to the Patient. The degree to which the Patient is damaged. An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with a Patient to accomplish the damage. Any description of the action of damaging which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the damage. This role identifies the location of the scene where a Agent damages a Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent causes the damage to the Patient. A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action. The part of the Patient which is directly affected by the damaging. This role identifies the time when the Agent damages the Patient. The entity which is affected by the Agent so that it is damaged. A description of the state of the Patient after the damaging has taken place, including descriptions of the severity and the permanence of the damaged condition. Result of the Agent's action. An event which leads to the damage of the Patient.

frame_definition: An Agent performs some Action which is considered imprudent.
role_definitions: The individual that performs the Action, resulting in danger to themself. This role denotes the Action taken by the Agent. The purpose for which the Action is performed. The Explanation the Agent takes the risk. The time at which the Agent dares to perform the Action. The location where the Agent risks doing the Action. Any description of the risking action which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: A Protagonist is in the dynamic, maintained state of being alive or has exited this state.
role_definitions: Explanation identifies any object or event that brings about the death of the Protagonist. This role identifies the Degree to which a Protagonist is dead or alive. Protagonist identifies the being or entity that is dead or alive. This role identifies the Figure or form being described by the target. The time in which the Protagonist is dead or alive.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe the death of a Protagonist.
role_definitions: The role Protagonist is the being or entity that dies. With verbs in this frame, the Protagonist is the External Argument. The role Explanation expresses any object or eventuality that brings about the Protagonist's death. Some measure of the event, generally frequency. The role Depictive denotes the state of the Protagonist as the death occurred. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The role Result indicates what occurs as the result of the death of the Protagonist. The role Place indicates where the death takes place. The role Time denotes when the dying or killing occurs. This role identifies the larger event in which the Protagonist dies, i.e. changes from living to dead. An individual negatively affected by the death of the Protagonist.

frame_definition: An State_of_affairs will come to hold with respect to a Protagonist at some future time.
role_definitions: The State_of_affairs that is destined to occur to the Protagonist. The Protagonist is the one for whom the future State_of_affairs is destined. A description of the sort of State_of_affairs that will occur. The Role filled by the Protagonist in his/her destiny. The time for which the Protagonist's future is determined. The location in which State_of_affairs is destined to occur to the Protagonist. The way in which the State_of_affairs is destined to occur to the Protagonist.

frame_definition: A Destroyer (a conscious entity) or Cause (an event, or an entity involved in such an event) affects the Patient negatively so that the Patient no longer exists.
role_definitions: The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs the intentional action that results in the Patient's destruction. The degree to which the destruction is completed. An entity directed by the Destroyer that interacts with a Patient to accomplish the Patient's destruction. Any description of the process of destruction which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Destroyer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Destroyer that accomplishes the destruction. This role identifies the place where the Destroyer destroys the Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which a Destroyer causes the destruction of the Patient. A state of affairs that the Destroyer is responding to in destroying the Undergoer. This role identifies the Result of an event on the Patient. This role is very rare in this frame, and since the Patient is destroyed by this process, the Result is generally constrained to indicate the Patient 's resulting inexistence. The part of the Patient which is directly affected by the destruction. This role identifies the time when the Destroyer destroys the Patient. The entity which is destroyed by the Destroyer. The event or entity which is responsible for the destruction of the Patient. The category in which the Patient is destroyed. How often the Cause or Destroyer destroys the Patient. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. Medium expresses the Medium in which the Patient is destroyed by the Cause or Destroyer. This role is generally used in Metaphorical uses of this frame.

frame_definition: The Detaching frame covers two situations: a scene in which somebody causes one thing to be physically detached from something else; or a scene in which somebody causes two things to be disconnected from each other.
role_definitions: The individual that causes the Item and Source to come apart by manipulating the connector. This role identifies the Item that the Agent detaches from the Source. This role identifies the Result of a detaching event. Source identifies the location to which an Item was attached before getting detached. This role identifies the plural Items that are detached from each other, resulting in their separation. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent detaches an Item or Items. Any description of the detaching event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). This role identifies the Place where the Agent detaches an Item or Items. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Agent intentionally detaches an Item or Items. This role identifies the Time when the Agent detaches the Item from the Source. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Agent detaches an Item or Items. Typically, it transmits the force applied by the Agent, and is not left behind as a participant in the resultant state. This role identifies the Degree to which the Item ends up detached.

frame_definition: An Agent causes an Explosive device to explode.
role_definitions: The Agent detonates the Explosive. This role identifies the place where the Agent detonates the Explosive. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent detonates the Explosive. This role identifies the time when the Agent detonates the Explosive. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent detonates the Explosive. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action ( deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Explosive causes damage to surrounding objects when operated by the Agent. The Outcome is the failure or success of the Agent's detonating the Explosive his or her Purpose. An event within which the Agent detonates the Explosive. Often, the Containing_event will also give an indication of the Agent's Purpose. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question 'how often.' This role modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. This frame element selects some gradable attribute of the Explosive or the detonation act and modifies the expected value for it. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state. An implement used by the Agent to detonate the Explosive. The Victim (typically an individual or structure) is targeted by the explosion or inadvertantly damaged by the explosion. May be indicated explicitly with on or against, but is often implied by place expressions, in which case the role is indicated on the second layer.

frame_definition: An Agent or a Cause disperses or scatters Individuals from the Source,a relatively confined space, to a the Goal_area, a broader space.
role_definitions: The Agent disperses or scatters the Individuals. The Individuals are scattered by the Agent. Source is the relatively confined space from which an Agent scatters the Individuals. Goal_area identifies the broader space to which the Agent scatters the Individuals An event or force that causes that Individuals to disperse. Any description of the dispersing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (eagerly, carefully). The Time when the Individuals are dispersed. An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the dispersal. A state of the Individuals that results from the dispersal. The trajectory along which the Individuals move. The Place where the dispersing event happens. A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in dispersing the Individuals The distance that the Individuals move from their original location, the Source. The rate of motion of the Individuals, usually in terms of how long it takes for them to leave the Source and end up in the Goal_area.

frame_definition: A Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming moving Bad_entity.
role_definitions: The Dodger acts to avoid an oncoming Bad_entity. The Bad_entity is the oncoming entity to avoid. This role identifies the Degree to which the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Manner in which the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Place where the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Time at which the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Purpose for which the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Explanation for which the dodging occurs. This role identifies the Means by which the dodging occurs.

frame_definition: An Agent, by virtue of strength or forcefulness, controls, rules, or strongly influences some Patient in some Situation.
role_definitions: The Agent controls the Patient by being forceful and possibly aggressive. The Patient is trying to gain control of a situation, but ends up being subject to the control and influence of the Agent. The Situation within which the Agent is able to gain control over the Patient (thus excluding them from controlling the Situation). The period of time over which the domination occurs. A description of the event as a whole, or of any of the participants that does not fit any of the other more specific Frame Elements. The place where the domination occurs. The time when the domination takes place. The Degree to which the Agent dominates the Patient.

frame_definition: An Agent disables a flying or floating Patient, causing it to be unable to support itself in its current medium.
role_definitions: The Agent forces the Patient to come to the ground. The Patient is the entity that is being forced to the ground. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action. The Result of causing the Patient to come to the ground. An act performed by an Agent that enables them to force the Patient to the ground. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The time at which the event takes place. The location at which the event takes place. An event which causes the Patient to come to the ground. An object used by the Agent to facilitate bringing down the Patient.

frame_definition: An Earner receives Earnings by providing Goods to a Buyer; providing the Goods also generally entails a cost, which may or may not be included in the consideration.
role_definitions: The Buyer is the source of the Earnings of the Earner. The Earner is involved in a transaction or set of transactions as the party that receives payment. Earnings are the money given to the Earner in a transaction, generally in exchange for Goods. Goods is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for Earnings in a transaction. In some cases, earning is described per unit of Goods. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. The means by which the Earner gains money. Any description of the action of earning which reveals correllated details, especially characterizations of the Earner which influence the event. A state of affairs that the Earner intends to bring about as a result of participating in the Commercial Transaction. The location where the Earner makes their Earnings. The time when the Earner makes their Earnings. This role identifies an event during which the Earner receives Earnings in a transaction. This role denotes a proposition from which the event of earning or losing logically follows.

frame_definition: This frame contains words referring to teaching and the participants in teaching.
role_definitions: One who instructs a Student in some area of knowledge or skill. One who is instructed by a Teacher in skills or knowledge. An educational establishment, such as a school or college. The area of knowledge or skill which is taught by a Teacher or to a Student. This role identifies the Level of a student in his/her education. This is distinct from the goal or qualification towards which a student is working (Qualification ). A formal Qualification such as an academic degree or a certificate for which a student is aiming. Degree to which event occurs Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action Manner of performing an action An intentional action performed by the actor (Student or Teacher depending on the profiling of particular words) that lets them achieve the instruction or learning they are attempting. Result of an event The time when the teaching occurs. The Place is the location within which the teaching takes place. Consider whether a possible Place phrase is really where the training took place or is rather part of a description of the Institution. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. An action which the Student is able to perform as a result of instruction. A guideline for correct behavior. In most cases, this concerns morally or socially desirable actions. A piece of information that the Student is informed of by the Teacher. Educational Material, such as books, tapes, or videos, used by a Teacher or a Student to acquire skills or knowledge. A role, typically professional or vocational, that the Student is meant to be able to fill as a result of their training. FN: a program of lectures or other matter dealing with a subject The state-of-affairs that the Teacher hopes to bring about by teaching.

frame_definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State has an emotion as brought on by an Stimulus or Topic.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible Stimulus. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer. The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as having said emotion.

frame_definition: An Experiencer can be described as having an emotion as induced by a Stimulus.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer has an emotion as caused by the Stimulus. This role sums up what is expressed in the main clause, often with a VPing.

frame_definition: A Topic or Stimulus fails or succeeds at causing an emotion in an Experiencer, which is conveyed by an Expressor or manifested in a State or description of an Event.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible Stimulus. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer. The Event is the occasion or happening that Experiencers in a certain emotional state participate in. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus.
