Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, Event, or State can be described as having said emotion. The number of times the Experiencer feels the emotion.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause is responsible for placing a Valued_entity at risk.
role_definitions: An (non-sentient) entity or state of affairs that leads to the peril to the Valued_entity. The entity which may be negatively impacted as a result of the emperilment. The sentient entity which causes the risk to the Valued_entity. The specific event or state of affairs brought about by the Agent or Cause which endangers the Valued_entity. The Manner describes an aspect of the endangering act that is not directly related to the cause, intermediate action, or entity involved. The location where the Valued_entity is put in danger. The time when the Valued_entity is put in danger.

frame_definition: An Agent acts to ensure that a Rule (often a constraint on behavior) is being followed.
role_definitions: The Rule is the set of constrants on behavior that the Agent implements (i.e., forces others to obey or face consequences). The length of time for which the Rule is or is not in effect. The Time at which the Agent enforces the Rule. The Place at which the Rule is or is not enforced. The state-of-affairs under which the Agent puts the Rule into effect. A cause, reason, or other explanation for the enforcing of the Rule. The individual or group who is obligated to follow the Rule. The Agent, often an institution, governmental organization, or arm thereof, puts into effect (i.e., enforces) a Rule. The Manner describes some state of the Agent, or provides additional characterization of the event. The Means is an intermediate action done by the Agent in order to enforce the Rule. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Agent enforces the Rule. This role describes how fully the Rule was enforced. This role describes the medium through which the rule was enforced. It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent. The Outcome is the failure or success of enforcing the rule.

frame_definition: A Self-moving Escapee departs from an Undesirable_location.
role_definitions: The Escapee manages to leave the Undesirable_location. Goal identifies any expression which tells where the Escapee ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion.  covers any act performed by the Escapee brings about the escape. Manner is used for any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion, including descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, etc. The Undesirable_location is where the Escapee begins. Speed idenitifies the rate at which the escaping occurs. Vehicle identifies the means of conveyance by which the Escapee leaves the Undesirable_location. This role identifies the Time when the escaping occurs. This role identifies the Purpose for which the escaping takes place. This role identifies the Place where the Escaping occurs. Depictive identifies a word or phrase describing a participant of an action. Path describes the trajectory of motion of the Escapee. This role identifies the (abstract) nearness of the Escapee to being caught in the Undesirable_location. The distance along a path away from the Undesirable_location that the Escapee travels. The situation that explains why the (instance of) the event occurred.

frame_definition: An Event takes place at a Place and Time.
role_definitions: Name of the event which occurs. Where the event takes place. The Explanation for which an event occurs. When the event occurs. How long the Event takes place. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). How often the Event occurs. The period within which an Event has occurred.

frame_definition: This frame deals with testing or examination of someone's Knowledge or skill in a particular area.
role_definitions: One who administers a test of some kind. One who undergoes a test of some kind. The ability, practice, or command of information on which an Examinee is tested. A credential or status that one acquires by passing an Examination. The Examination that somebody takes. An act whereby the Examiner assesses the Examinee. The state-of-affairs that the Examiner wants to bring about by giving the Examinee the Examination. The location where the examination takes place. The time at which the examination occurs. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Examiner that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: Two parties, the Exchangers, each give and receive from the other Themes.
role_definitions: In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, this role identifies the conversational participant with greater semantic and syntactic prominence, as compared with Exchanger_2. That is, Exchanger_1 is generally encoded as Subject, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to Exchanger_1. Thus a Purpose (or Means, Depictive, or Manner) is construed to be that of Exchanger_1, not necessarily that of Exchanger_2 or the group of Exchangers as a whole. This role identifies the place where the exchange occurs. This role identifies the purpose for which Exchanger_1 or the Exchangers make the trade. This role identifies the time when the exchange takes place. This role identifies the Means by which Exchanger_1 or the Exchangers effect the trade. Any description of the exchange act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of Exchanger_1 or Exchangers that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). In cases where the Exchangers involved in a conversation are construed as two separate groups with different levels of volitionality or control, Exchanger_2 refers to the semantically and grammatically less prominent group. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with). Note that it is possible for a single role to correspond to multiple referents. For example, if the prepositional object in the example below were plural, we would still assign it the single role Exchanger_2. In some sentences both participants are expressed by the Subject, and there is no 'with'-phrase (cf example 1). In sentences like this, the Subject is assigned the role role Exchangers. In such sentences, the Subject always denotes more than one person, and it is understood that the reciprocal communication takes place between these two (or more) people. The Subject may denote two or more people either through conjunction, as in example 1, or through plurality, as in example 2, or by denoting a group, as in example 3. In each of these cases the role Exchangers is assigned. Notice that for nouns in the Exchange frame, it is possible for the Exchangers role to be expressed by a prepositional phrase as in example 4. The state of Exchanger_1 or Exchangers during the exchange. The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_1. The item that begins in the possession of Exchanger_2. The items which change possession between the Exchangers. This frame element denotes how often the Exchangers trade Themes. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.

frame_definition: An Agent acts according to a Plan, carrying it out (or taking steps to carry it out).
role_definitions: The Plan is a goal or purpose that the Agent carries out. The length of time for which the Plan is or is not in effect. The Time at which the Agent puts the Plan into effect. The Place at which the Plan is or is not operational. [CHANGE: or, place where agent puts into effect? 2 fes?] The state-of-affairs under which the Agent puts the Plan into effect. A cause, reason, or other explanation for the implementation of the Plan The individual or group who is obligated to follow the Plan. [CHANGE: may only be relevant for 'implemented the policy for residents of florida only'] The Agent, often an institution or governmental organization, puts a Plan into effect. The Agent is generally a primary participant in the Plan, but a separate Focal_participant may be specified. The Manner describes some state of the Agent, or provides additional characterization of the event of executing the plan. The Means is an intermediate action done by the Agent in order to execute the Plan. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Agent executes the Plan. This role describes how fully the Plan was executed. This role describes the medium through which a plan was executed. It may occur in the same syntactic position as the Agent. The Outcome is the failure or success of executing the plan.

frame_definition: An Executioner punishes an individual (Executed) with death as a consequence of some action of the Evaluee (the Reason).
role_definitions: The Executioner is the individual who performs the execution. This role identifies the Instrument with which an Executioner performs an execution. The action that is taken that accomplishes the execution Where the execution takes place. The purpose for which the execution is carried out. The punishment of death given to the Executed by the Executioner. When the execution occurs. Degree to which event occurs. This role identifies any Depictive phrase describing a participant in the action. The Executed is the person who is killed by the Executioner in retribution for the crime that the Executed was convicted of. Any description of the execution event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Moreover, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Executioner that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Often, there is a constituent expressing the Explanation for the Judge's judgment which the Executioner is carrying out. It is usually a for-PP. Result of an event

frame_definition: An Agent actively maintains or improves their level of phyiscal fitness.
role_definitions: The person who is trying to improve or maintain their physical fitness. An area of the Agent's body that the activity is direct at. Something that the Agent uses to exercise. A general description of how the Agent acts while exercising. The time that the Agent exercises. The location of the Agent while exercising. How often the Agent works on their fitness. This frame element describes a subtype of the more general exercise category. The purpose for which the Agent exercises.

frame_definition: An Experiencer is involved in a bodily injury to a Body_part.
role_definitions: The location on the body of the Experiencer where the bodily injury takes place. The event in which the bodily injury takes place. Manner in which the injury takes place. The place where the harming event occurs. The being or entity that is injured. The time when the harming event occurs. The Experiencer injures him/herself on an Injuring_entity. The extent to which the Experiencer is affected by the injury. The number of times that the injury happens to the Experiencer. The period of time during which the Experiencer repeatedly receives bodily injuries. The number of times that the Experiencer has an experience of bodily harm.

frame_definition: Due to chemical, nuclear, or other reactions, an Explosive explodes, potentially causing damage to the surrounding area.
role_definitions: The Explosive releases a large amount of force, destroying itself and causing damage to the surrounding area. The Time when the explosion occurs. The location where the explosion occurs. The Victim is targeted by the explosion or inadvertantly damaged by the explosion. Typically expressed by an on-PP. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the explosion occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The means by which the Explosive explodes. A description of the explosion not specifically covered by other Frame Elements. The strength of the explosion, or to what degree it damaged the affected areas or objects. How often an explosion occurs.

frame_definition: A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
role_definitions: The Authorities act on behalf of the Current_jurisdiction, giving up the Suspect to the Crime_jurisdiction. The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the Suspect starts off in. The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the Suspect is sent. The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried. The Purpose for which the Authorities extradite the Suspect. The Explanation for which the Authorities extradite the Suspect. This role indicates the basis in law of an extradition. The time at which the Suspect is moved. A description of the manner of the extradition. A description of the Authorities or Suspect during the extradition. The act of the Authorities which brings about the transfer from the Current_jurisdiction to the Crime_jurisdiction. The location where the extradition occurs.

frame_definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as characterized as having an emotion of fear concerning a particular Topic or as evoked by a Stimulus.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible Stimulus. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion.

frame_definition: These are words relating to filling containers and covering areas with some thing, things or substance, the Theme.
role_definitions: The Agent is the actor who instigates the filling. The Theme is the physical object or substance which changes location. The Source is the location where the Theme begins its motion. The Path is the trajectory of the motion. The Goal is the area or container being filled. Goal is generally the NP Object in this frame. Degree to which the filling occurs. Depictive phrase describing the Agent of the filling action. The Manner in which the filling occurs. The Means by which the filling occurs. The Result is the resultant state after the filling has occurred. The Explanation for which the Agent fills or covers the Goal. When the filling occurs. Where the filling takes place. The purpose for which the Agent fills the Goal. The Instrument with which the filling occurs. The Subregion is the smaller area of the Goal where the filling or covering occurs. An event which brings about the filling of the Goal.

frame_definition: The Payer is (legally) forced to pay a Fine by an official Speaker as a punishment for some action (the Reason).
role_definitions: The Speaker is the person who imposes the Fine upon the Payer. The Instrument with which the fining is performed. The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward. Where the event takes place. The Purpose for which an intentional act is performed. When the event occurs. The Payer is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment is made. With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object: A description of the event (or state) not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of the Speaker that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Judge's judgment. It is usually a for-PP, e.g. I admire you for your intellect. For some words in this domain, the Reason frame element is obligatory. That is to say, the overt expression of this frame element may only be omitted when the reason for the judgment is understood from context. For example, the sentence 'I blame you!' can only be uttered when it is clear what the addressee is being blamed for. The Result of an event. The money given to expiate some debt for transgression. In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. This role is any Unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. The imposition of a debt due to culpable behavior. The Degree to which the Fine is punitive to the Payer.

frame_definition: An Employer ends an employment relationship with an Employee.
role_definitions: The person who is let go by their Employer. The person (or institution) that end an employment relationship with an Employee. This role identifies the Manner in which an Employer fires an Employee. This role identifies the Place where the Employer fires the Employee. The label given to a particular type of employment. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Employer fires the Employee. The action that the Employee is relieved from doing for the Employer . This role identifies the Time when an Employer fires the Employee. The Explanation for which the Employee is terminated. The means whereby the Employer fires the Employee

frame_definition: A Self_mover responds to a (real or imagined) danger by moving away from it.
role_definitions: Self_mover is the living (or self-directed) being which moves under its own power. Source is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion involving a landmark which is neither a Source nor a Goal. This includes 'middle of path'' expressions. Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion. An expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory or rate of motion. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance. The time when the motion occurs. An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the Self_mover, following and tracking the Self_mover, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching Paths. The rate at which the location of the Self_mover changes with respect to time. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action An act whereby the Self_mover achieves movement. The state of the world which exists because of the motion of the Self_mover The emotional or mental state of the Self_mover which motivates them toward motion or the particular manner of motion. The amount of time for which the Self_mover moves. This role identifies the purpose for which a Self_mover moves. The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place. Any specified or implied Source, Path or Goal should designate a location contained with the Place. The state of affairs that leads to the particular motion that the Self_mover adopts. External_cause is something in the external environment that causes the Self_mover to move. The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion. The entity used by the Self_mover in getting away from the undesirable Source.

frame_definition: An Agent produces a Forgery, an entity that they intend to pass off as a particular (instance of) a Standard.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person that creates a Forgery with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the Standard. The Forgery is the product that the Agent creates with the intent of passing it off as (an instance of) the Standard. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An act performed by the Agent that accomplishes the imitation.  The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the forging event logically follows. An action or state that the Agent intends to accomplish by producing the Forgery. The Standard is the actually existing or imagined (kind of) thing that the Agent wants to pass the Forgery off as. An entity manipulated by the Agent in order to produce the Forgery. The location in which the Agent makes a Forgery. The time at which the forgery takes place. The way in which the Forgery does or does not match the Standard. An entity corresponding to the Standard which the Agent scrutinizes in order to copy.

frame_definition: Partner_1 interacts with Partner_2 (also collectively expressible as Partners) to change their social relationship.
role_definitions: The individual who comes to form a relationship with Partner_2. The individual whose relationship with Partner_1 changes. The individuals whose relationship is changing. The action that Partner_1 or the Partners take in order to bring about the change in the relationship. The time when the relationship changes. Any description of the event including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Partner_1 or Partners that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A salient state of Partner_1, Partner_2, or Partners which affects the perception of the formation of relationship. The length of time that the changed relationship status lasts. Where the relationship is formed. The state-of-affairs that the Partners or Partner_1 hope to bring about by changing their status. This role indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the Forming_relationship event operates (often denoted by words such as 'officially,' 'formally,' 'technically,' etc.). How often the Forming_relationship event occurs. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.

frame_definition: This frame describes an Agent's gathering of Individuals (people or entities) into a group, the Aggregate, defined by relative proximity.
role_definitions: This role identifies the aggregate that results from the gathering. It may be expressed either as an adjunct result phrase or as a direct object of a target verb. Agent is the person who gathers Individuals. This role identifies the time when the gathering event occurs, if specified. The crowd assembled at dawn. An act performed by the Agent that accomplishes the gathering. This role identifies the place where the gathering event occurs. He assembled the children in the hall. This role identifies the entities that come together to form an Aggregate. The way in which the Individuals are gathered up. An Instrument that the Agent uses to gather the Individuals together. The state of affairs that the Agent is attempting to bring about by gathering. This frame element is defined as the number of times the Gathering_up event occurs per some unit of time. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the Gathering_up event occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. Goal designates the location where the Individuals might end up. The Co-participant participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the primary protagonist. The Path is the trajectory of motion that the Individuals take. The Source is the location where the Individuals are at the beginning of the gathering event.

frame_definition: The words in this frame have to do with non-verbal communication.
role_definitions: This is the sentient entity that communicates a Message non-verbally. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: The teacher gestured us into the room. This is the person to whom a non-verbal Message is communicated. It may be expressed as an NP Object or as a PP Complement: The teacher gestured us into the room. The teacher gestured to us to enter the room. This is the content of non-verbal communication. It may be expressed as a that-clause Complement, a to-marked infinitive VP Complement, or a directional PP Complement: The teacher gestured that it was time to leave. The teacher gestured to us to enter the room. The teacher gestured us into the room. Manner of performing an action An act performed by the Communicator that results in the successful transfer of a Message. The Body_part is the specific body part of the Communicator which gestures. When the gesturing occus. The Place is where the gesturing occurs. The Indicated_entity is the entity which the Communicator is pointing out to the Addressee as meaningful. An Instrument that the Communicator uses to gesture to the Addressee together.

frame_definition: A new Employee obtains a Position with an Employer, with which there are certain Tasks associated; in exchange for the performance of these Tasks, the Employee receives Compensation from the Employer.
role_definitions: The Compensation is the payment that the Employee receives for performing a Task. The person who enters an employment relation with an Employer. The person (or institution) that the Employee enters an employment relationship with. This role identifies the Manner in which an Employee enters an employment relationship with an Employer. This role identifies the place where the Employee enteres an employment relationship with an Employer. The label given to a particular type of employment. This role identifies the purpose for which an Employee enters an employment relationship. The action that the Employee is obligated to do for the Employer. This role identifies the Time when an Employee signs on with an Employer. The action by which the Employee enters an employment relationship. The Contract_basis is the condition of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period or payment arrangements.

frame_definition: A Recipient starts off without the Theme in their possession, and then comes to possess it.
role_definitions: The Recipient indicates the entity that ends up in possession of the Theme. The Theme is the object that changes possession. The Source is the location that the Theme formerly occupied. Persons that begin in possession of the Theme may metonymically stand in for the Source. The Place denotes where the Getting takes place. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. The Explanation refers to the existing eventuality that the Recipient is responding to. When the event occurs. The Means is the action of the Recipient which results in their possession of the Theme. This role identifies the Manner in which an Agent intentionally acts. The state that either the Recipient or the Theme end up in after the acquisition. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause. The Beneficiary is an entity which the Recipient passes the Theme to, or shares the Theme with. Any condition or situation that serves as a very general background, against which the further importance of the Getting is understood.

frame_definition: A Theme, which may or may not have a default shape or configuration, goes into a particular shape without being made to do so by an agent.
role_definitions: Where the shape-changing event takes place. The Explanation for which the change into the shape occurs. When the changing into a particular shape occurs. How long the event takes place. Any description of the shape-changing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). How often the shape changing occurs. The Theme goes into a particular shape. The Result is the shape the Theme becomes. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The conditions under which the Theme is shaped. The state of the Theme with respect to the change brought about by making the adjustment.

frame_definition: In this frame a Grinder or Grinding_cause causes a Patient to be broken into smaller pieces.
role_definitions: An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that grinds. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic. The Grinder breaks the Patient into smaller pieces. This role identifies the Instrument with which the Grinder grinds the Patient. The Locus is a description of the active zone of the Grinder, where the grinding most saliently takes place. This role identifies the Manner in which the Grinder grinds the Patient. This role identifies the Means by which the Grinder grinds the Patient. This role identifies the Place where the Grinder grinds the Patient. This role identifies the Purpose for which the Grinder grinds the Patient. The Result is the shape the Patient becomes. This role identifies the Time when the Grinder grinds the Patient. The Patient is the entity which undergoes the change brought about by the Grinder or Grinding_cause. The length of time for which the Grinder grinds the Patient. This is where the Patient might end up, after undergoing the grinding process.

frame_definition: In this frame, an Agent engages in personal body care by grooming either a Patient or a Body_part.
role_definitions: Result of the grooming event. The agent is the person who does the grooming. The patient is the person who gets washed. This is an object that aids the washing process. This is the region of the body that gets groomed. This is a region of the object, body or the body part that gets groomed. Medium is the substance that is the grooming agent. The frequency with which the Agent groom himself/other. This role identifies the Manner in which an Agent intentionally acts. This role identifies the time when the event occurs. Where the event takes place. How long the grooming takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Agent is trying to bring about by grooming. The action performed by the Agent to accomplish the grooming.

frame_definition: A Communicator announces (linguistically or non-linguistically) the imminent arrival of an Individual or the occurrence of an Event.
role_definitions: The Communicator greets the arrival of an Individual or occurrence of an Event. This role identifies the place where the Communicator heralds. This role identifies the purpose for which a Communicator heralds. This role identifies the time when the Communicator heralds. This role identifies the Means by which a Communicator heralds. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Communicator that also affect the heralding ( eagerly, carefully). The person who is greeted at their arrival by the Communicator. The occurrence which is greeted by the Communicator. The symbol-containing artifact whereby a Communicator heralds.

frame_definition: An Employer hires an Employee, promising the Employee a certain Compensation in exchange for the performance of a job.
role_definitions: The person whom the Employer takes on as an Employee, obligating them to perform some Task in order to receive Compensation. The person (or institution) that takes on an Employee, giving them Compensation in return for the performance of an assigned Task. The Compensation is the payment that the Employee is set to receive for performing an assigned Task. This role identifies the Manner in which an Employer hires an Employee. This role identifies the place where the Employer hires the Employee. This role identifies the Time when an Employer hires the Employee. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Employer hires the Employee. The action that the Employee is taken on by the Employer to do. The label given to a particular type of employment. The Field that the Employee is going to work in for their Employer. An entity that the Employer uses to hire the Employee. An action by the Employer whereby the hire is brought about. The Contract_basis is the condition of employment with respect to permanency, hours per time period or payment arrangements. The length of time from when the hiring event began to be repeated to when it stopped.

frame_definition: In the course of history, an Event or Entity is taken to have importance or significance.
role_definitions: This role identifies the event which occurs to create history. This role identifies where the event takes place. This role identifies the time when the event occurs. This role identifies the Explanation for which an event occurs. This role identifies the entity, concrete or abstract. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The Domain is (a characterization of) the type of event that is part of the Event's history. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.

frame_definition: An Agent causes the ballistic motion of a projectile and its subsequent impact on a Target.
role_definitions: The entity which is hit by a Projectile directed by the Agent. The individual that directs the Projectile such that it impacts the Target. The state-of-affairs that the Agent hopes to bring about by hitting the Target The time at which the Agent hits the Target. The location where the event happens. The part of the Target hit by the Agent. The action performed by the Agent that accomplishes hitting the Target. The entity, most often ammunition or a firearm, which the Agent manipulates to hit the Target. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: This frame consists of words that describe a hostile encounter between opposing forces (Side_1 and Side_2, collectively conceptualizable as Sides) over a disputed Issue and/or in order to reach a specific Purpose. ''
role_definitions: One of two participants in a hostile encounter. One of two participants in a hostile encounter, usually the second mentioned. The jointly expressed sides in a hostile encounter. An unresolved question over which the two sides of a hostile encounter are in disagreement. The desired result of the outcome of the hostile encounter for the Side_1 or for all the Sides collectively. It may either directly refer to the state of affairs that is desired, e.g. Means describes the way in which a side engages in a hostile encounter. Any expression which describes a property of the hostile encounter. Descriptions of the intensity count as Manner expressions. The location at which the hostile encounter takes place. The Time at which the hostile encounter occurs. The Degree to which an event occurs. A Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action. The Result of an event. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. The Explanation for which an event occurs. The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed. The body movement may be prompted by either some outside phenomenon or occurrence, or by an Internal Cause, the Agent's mental or emotional state. Internal Cause is expressed in a PP complement. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.

frame_definition: A Duty is imposed on a Responsible_party according to a Principle which regulates how the Responsible_party should respond to a Situation.
role_definitions: The person who must perform the Duty. The action that the Responsible_party is obligated to perform. This role indicates the Conditions under which the Responsible_party is obligated to perform the Duty . The time interval during which the Duty is imposed on the Responsible_party by the Obligator or the Situation. A location in which the Responsible_party has a specified Duty . The Obligator is the person who imposes the Duty on the Responsible_party. A state of affairs that results in the Responsible_party being obligated to carry out the Duty in accordance with the Principle. A regulating idea (which may be instantiated as a document) that the Responsible_party is subject to. The state-of-affairs that the Obligator hopes to bring about by imposing the obligation. Any holistic description of the details of the action, either comparing to another event or describing the action in terms of characteristics of the Obligator that affect the action holistically. An event which brings about the obligation.

frame_definition: The Authorities put a Prisoner in Prison as punishment for an Offense.
role_definitions: The person who is confined in a penal institution. The Prison within which the Prisoner comes to be confined. The Authorities are the institution or actors carrying out the imprisonment. The action that the Prisoner is being punished for. This role identifies the Place where the Prisoner is kept. The time when the imprisonment happens. The purpose of the imprisonment. An intentional action performed by the Authorities that brings about the imprisonment. Any description of the imprisoning event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Authorities that affect the action (ruthlessly). The act or state of affairs that the Authorities respond to by imprisoning the Prisoner. This role identifies the Duration of time for which the Authorities maintains the confinement of the Prisoner. The legal classification which characterizes the Offense. Iterations marks expressions that indicate the number of times the Prisoner was imprisoned.

frame_definition: An Entity improves from a less desirable Prior_state to a more desirable Post_state.
role_definitions: The object that undergoes change. The former state of the Entity. The state of the Entity following the improvement. The time at which the improvement occurs. The rate at which the change happens. A description of the improvement, generally a description comparing events (the same way). The period over which the improvement occurs. The amount of improvement that the Entity has attained. The relevant dimension of improvement. An event or state of affairs that brings about the improvement of the Entity. The location where the Improvement occurs. This role describes the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames How often the Improvement event occurs. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

frame_definition: In this frame an Ingestor takes a Substance into his or her body.
role_definitions: The Manner in which the Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Means by which the Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Place where the Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Purpose for which the Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Time at which the Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Delivery_device is the means by which the Substance is ingested. The Ingestor ingests the Substance. The Substance is the drug or other substance that is ingested by the Ingestor. The Frequency with which the Ingestor ingests. The Entry_path is the path along which the Substance enters the Ingestor's body. The Duration is the length of time for which the Ingestor ingests.

frame_definition: An Ingestor consumes food or drink (Ingestibles), which entails putting the Ingestibles in the mouth for delivery to the digestive system.
role_definitions: The Ingestor is the person eating or drinking. Where the event takes place. When the event occurs. The Ingestibles are the entities that are being consumed by the Ingestor. The Instrument with which an intentional act is performed. Manner of performing an action. Place from which the Ingestor takes the Ingestibles An act performed by the Ingestor that enables them to accomplishes the whole act of ingestion. The extent to which the Ingestibles are consumed by the Ingestor. The action that the Ingestor hopes to bring about by ingesting. The length of time spent on the ingestion activity.

frame_definition: An Agent restricts the movement of a Theme to within the vicinity of the Holding_location, despite the Theme's desire, plan, or tendency towards motion; the Agent may also use an Instrument.
role_definitions: The entity which is confined. The area within which the Theme comes to be confined. The Agent is the person intentionally restricting the movement of the Theme. The Instrument with which the confinement is carried out. The reason for the confinement. This role identifies the Place where the event occurs. When the event occurs. The Purpose of the confinement. An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Agent that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action. This role identifies the Duration of time for which the Agent maintains the confinement of the Theme. The Cause is the non-sentient entity which is responsible for restricting the movement or location of the Theme.

frame_definition: A Self_mover intentionally moves in a Directionon a Path relative to landmark that is neither the Source nor the Goal of the overall motion.
role_definitions: This is a sentient being or a vehicle steered by a sentient being which moves. Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path, excluding directional expressions: Any expression which indicates where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a Self_mover that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance. An event involving the Self_mover that results in their moving in the specified way. The Speed is the rate at which the Self_mover moves. This is a second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique, relative to which the Self_mover moves. Depictive phrase describing the Self_mover. The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located. The configuration formed by the entire Path of the Self_mover, taken simultaneously. The direction in which the Self_mover goes. The time at which the motion takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Self_mover wishes to bring about. The device or bodypart that serves to move the Self_mover. The length of time that the Self_mover spends in motion. A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the Self_mover. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time the Intentional_traversing occurs and which the Intentional_traversing is taken to be a part of. The number of times that an action occurs in a given time. A larger conceptualization that includes the Intentional_traversing as an integral part. The Intentional_traversing expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Self_mover), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the Intentional_traversing. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Traversing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole. The Source and Goal of either a single or a repeated motion taken together as Endpoints of the Path. Co-participant is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the same event as the primary protagonist, regardless of whether the protagonist, and hence the Co-participant, is more agent- or more undergoer-like.

frame_definition: This is an abstract frame for acts performed by sentient beings.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Act that the Agent performs intentionally. The Agent performs the intentional act. This role identifies the place where the intentional act occurs. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent performs an intentional act. John flattered her to receive a raise. This role identifies the time when the Agent acts intentionally. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent acts intentionally. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Domain within which the Agent acts. The Frequency with which the Agent does the Act in a given period of time. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The Result of an act. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. This role gives a description of the Intentionally_act event. This role describes an additional situation or modification that would seem to hold given the rest of the situation. In some cases, it marks a completely separate conclusion than one would draw from the manner of the event in the main clause. As far as we know, this idea is only explicitly marked in English with 'as if'.

frame_definition: The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.
role_definitions: The Creator creates a created entity. This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity. This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent intentionally creates a new entity. This role identifies the Components that are attached together to form a Created_entity. This role identifies a depictive phrase describing the actor or undergoer of an action. This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates. Any description of the creation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a Creator that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). This role identifies the Means by which a Creator intentionally creates a new entity. This role identifies the instrument with which an Agent intentionally creates a Created_entitiy. The role of Created_entity. A secondary agent with whom the Creator intentionally creates the Created_entity.

frame_definition: A volitionally acting Interceptor takes control, without being authorized to do so by the sender, of a Theme that is underway from a sender to a recipient.
role_definitions: The volitional agent who without authorization of sender or recipient takes control of a Theme that is en route to a destination. The entity, physical or abstract, construed as traveling from a sender to a goal location, which is taken hold of by the Interceptor without permission. The location at which the Interceptor takes control of the Theme. The time period during which the Interceptor takes control of the Theme. This role describes a participant of the intercepting event as being in some state during the action. Any description of the Intercepting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate also salient characteristics of the Interceptor that also affect the action (carefully). The circumstances under which the interception takes place. The state of affairs that the Interceptor hopes to bring about by intercepting. The action performed by the Interceptor that results in success.

frame_definition: A Cause (or associated Actor) causes an ongoing Process to temporarily stop.
role_definitions: A force, process, or event that produces the interruption. The Process goes into a paused state due to the Cause or Actor. Where the interruption takes place. This role identifies the Time when the interruption occurs. An entity which participates in a Cause, perhaps volitionally and perhaps not, but effectively causing the interruption. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. Any holistic description of the event, including overall depictions (the same way) and descriptions pertaining to the Actor or Cause's influence on the character of the event. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. An action or sub-event through which the Actor or Cause interrupts the Process. How often the interruption occurs. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

frame_definition: The Invader enters a Land in an aggressive attempt to cripple or dominate its people and its government.
role_definitions: The political area that is being crippled by the Invader's entry. An entity used by the Invader to assist in the invasion of the Land. The army or other self-directed entity that is entering the Land in a hostile manner. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Invader that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Invader that accomplishes the assault. This role identifies the location where the Invader invades the Land. This role identifies the purpose for which an Invader attacks the Land. A state of affairs that the Invader is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the Land. This role identifies the time when the Invader invades Land. The starting-point of the motion of the Invader or projectiles of the Invader as they move toward the the Place that the Land is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of the Invader or Land while the Invasion occurs. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily. The Result of the invasion on the Land by the Invader. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Form: once, twice, Cardinal expression + /it times, /it lots/a lot In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole and describes and describes the event more generally. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Invader travels. How often the Invader invades the Land. This role indicates the subtype of invasion into the Land. This role describes how intense the invation of the Land is. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. For how long the Land is invaded by the Invader.

frame_definition: An Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having a surprised emotion as evoked by a Stimulus or concerning a Topic.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Topic is the general area in which the emotion occurs. It indicates a range of possible Stimulus. The Stimulus is the person, event, or state of affairs that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Empathy_target is the individual or individuals with which the Experiencer identifies emotionally and thus shares their emotional response. The body part, gesture, or other expression of the Experiencer that reflects his or her emotional state. They describe a presentation of the experience or emotion denoted by the adjective or noun. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Stimulus evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Stimulus evokes its response. In some cases it may appear without an explicit Stimulus. Quite often in such cases, the Stimulus can be inferred from the Circumstances The State is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the Experiencer. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the Stimulus which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer, Expressor, or State can be described as having said emotion. Type describes the kind of response the Stimulus or Topic invoke in the Experiencer. Medium is the physical entity or channel used to transmit the experience invoked by the Stimulus.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will by force. ''
role_definitions: The Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) who carries off and holds the Victim against his or her will. The Victim is the person who is carried off and held against his/her will. Where the kidnapping takes place. When the kidnapping occurs. Source is the initial location of the Victim before it changes location. Goal is the place in which the Victim ends up. Degree to which event occurs Manner in which the kidnapping takes place. An act performed by the Perpetrator that helps them accomplish the kidnapping. The Purpose is what the Perpetrator hopes to accomplish by kidnapping. The Explanation expresses why the Perpetrator commits the kidnapping. The abduction of a Victim by a Perpetrator. An additional abductee taken along with the Victim. The period of time for which the Victim is held by the Perpetrator The number of times that the Victim is kidnapped.

frame_definition: A Killer or Cause causes the death of the Victim. '
role_definitions: The person or sentient entity that causes the death of the Victim. The living entity that dies as a result of the killing. An inanimate entity or process that causes the death of the Victim. The state of affairs that the Killer is trying to bring about by killing. The method or action that the Killer or Cause performs resulting in the death of the Victim. The preexisting state of affairs that the Killer is responding to. The location where the death took place. The point or period of time within which the Victim is killed. The state of the Killer or Victim during the killing. The state of the Victim that results from being killed. (Normally this is somewhat redundant.) The device used by the Killer to bring about the death of the Victim. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of a Killer that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Degree appears with adjectives to describe the killing potential of an object or with nouns to describe how widespread the killing is. This extra-thematic role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.

frame_definition: An Authority with the power to make decisions hands down a Finding over a question presented in a formal or informal Case.
role_definitions: The Authority (which may be the jury, judge, magistrate or court) decides on the Finding. This role identifies the outcome of the Authority's deliberation or consideration. This role describes the question on which the Authority gives a Finding. When the Authority gives his Finding. Where the Finding takes place. This role indicates the basis in law of a Finding. The Circumstances under which the ruling was reached. This role identifies the Manner in which the Authority acts. This role identifies the purpose why the Authority returns a particular Finding. This role identifies an action that the Authority performs in order to return the verdict. The Explanation for the Finding. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. This role indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the ruling event operates (often denoted by words such as 'officially,' 'formally,' 'technically,' etc.). The amount of time that a Finding holds. The person about whom the Authority passes a judgment or Finding.

frame_definition: The Lender gives the Theme to the Borrower with the expectation that the Borrower will return the Theme to the Lender after a Duration of time.
role_definitions: The person or institution who receives the Theme from the Lender for a Duration. The amout of time in which the Borrower has possession of the Theme. The person or institution who gives the Theme to the Borrower for a Duration. The object that is transferred from the Lender to the Borrower for a Duration. The aim of the Lender which they believe will be accomplished by lending the Theme to the Borrower. The time when the lending event occurs. The way in which the Lender lends the Theme. The location in which the Lender lends the Theme to the Borrower.

frame_definition: An Agent or Cause limits a Range_of_options to having a certain Characteristic.
role_definitions: The Agent consciously places limits upon the Range_of_options. The Cause is a natural occurrence or state-of-affairs that limits the Range_of_options. The Range_of_options would normally be expected to have a set of possibilites, but is limited by an Agent or Cause to particular subtypes, situations or characteristics. The Degree to which the Range_of_options has been limited. The Characteristic indicates the subtypes or situations to which the Range_of_options is limited. The time at which the limiting takes place. The length of time over which the Range_of_options is limited. The way in which the Agent of Cause limits the Range_of_options. The location in which the Agent or Cause limits the Range_of_options. An act performed by the Agent or Cause that accomplishes the action indicated by the target. The purpose for which the Agent or Cause limits the Range_of_options.

frame_definition: An Agent performs a series of unspecified tasks to plan for an Event to take place at a Scheduled_time and Place.
role_definitions: The person who makes arrangements for the Event to take place at a Time and Place. The incident for which the Agent has made arrangements. The person for whom the Event was arranged. The frequency with which the Agent organizes the Event. The way in which the Agent makes the arrangements for the Event. The means used by the Agent to make arrangements for the Event to take place. The location at which the Agent has made arrangements for the Event to take place. The Agent's motivation for arranging the Event. The cause for arranging the Event. The time for which the Agent has arranged the Event. This role describes the time at which the arrangements are made.

frame_definition: A Manipulator gets his Victim to perform a Resulting_action against what their better judgment would have been at the time.
role_definitions: The person who gets the Victim to act against their interest. The person who the Manipulator gets to do something they would not have done had no pressure or deception been applied. What the Manipulator intends to make the Victim do and the Victim actually does. This role identifies the Degree to which an event occurs. An act of the Manipulator that enables them to alter the action of the Victim. The role goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away. An entity that the Manipulator uses to get the Victim to perform the Resulting_action. A state-of-affairs that the Manipulator is hoping to bring about by manipulating the Victim. The time when the manipulation occurs. The location where the Manipulator manipulates the Victim. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including metaphorical force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a Manipulator that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe the manipulation of an Entity by an Agent.
role_definitions: The Agent manipulates an object. Agent typically refers to animate beings, but is also extended to mechanical and other inanimate objects. Agent is most frequently expressed as the external argument of verbs: The Entity being manipulated often occurs as the direct object of verbs: The Agent's manipulation of an Entity may be further specified as being localized to some part of the Entity, a Locus. The Locus is usually expressed as a PP Complement. The part of the Agent's body being used to manipulate the Entity may also be expressed. While the default is for an Agent to use his/her hands, other body parts may be specified. This frame element usually occurs as a PP-complement. This role identifies the Duration of the manipulation. The Manner of performing an action. This role identifies the Result of manipulation. When the manipulation takes place The Agent's purpose in performing the manipulation. An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with the Entity to accomplish the action indicated by the target. An action by the Agent to accomplish the desired manipulation. The spatial setting in which the manipulation takes place. This role identifies a depictive phrase describing the Agent or Bodypart_of_agent that holds throughout the action. A state of affairs leading to the manipulation. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states.

frame_definition: A Producer produces a Product from a Resource for commercial purposes. '
role_definitions: The person or company that produces the Product. The Product is produced by the Producer. Resource is the material that the product is made from. This role identifies the Place where the Product is manufactured. This Fe identifies the Time when the product was produced. Factory identifies the particular plant where the Product is manufactured. The Producer produces the Product for the Consumer. A phrase that describes the state of the Producer or the Product during the manufacturing process. This role identifies the Instrument with which a Producer produces a Product. This role identifies the Manner in which a Producer creates a Product. This role identifies the Means by which a Producer creates a Product. This role identifies the Purpose for which an Producer produces a Product. This role identifies the Circumstances under which the the product was produced. The number of manufacturing events in a given time period. The Locus is a description of the active zone of the Producer, where the manufacturing most saliently takes place.

frame_definition: A Mass_theme, generally made up of many individuals, moves from a Source to a Goal with some Path.
role_definitions: The mass of entities which moves. Degree of abundance. The place where the overall motion event takes place, thus including Source, Path, and Goal locations. When the event occurs. The Speed is the rate at which motion occurs. The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location. Path refers to (a part of the) ground the Mass_theme travels over or to a landmark the Mass_theme travels by. Goal is the location the Mass_theme ends up in. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. This role is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion. This frame element occurs throughout the motion domain but is very infrequent in Motion.Noise. The engine spluttered forward a short way and stopped. The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Mass_theme is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Mass_theme. Vehicles can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'. Any description of the motion event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Mass_theme that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully) The spatial setting in which the Mass_motion takes place. This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the Goal of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body. Often Direction is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Mass_theme, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer. In cases wherein the Mass_theme is construed as a sentient entities, this role denotes the state of affairs that the entities wish to bring about by mass movement.

frame_definition: The Military of a Possessor (either a nation, institution, or private individual) conducts large-scale activities in a Area to accomplish military or combined military/non-military goals.
role_definitions: The Force carries out the operation. Depending on the size of the operation, this may be as few as one individual or as large as the armed forces of a nation. The Possessor controls the army and ultimately directs its goals and methods. The Area in which the Military is conducting operations. The nation, group, or situation which the operation opposes. The Time at which the operations are carried out. The length of time over which the operation is carried out. A description of the operation or participants that are not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Military that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The means by which the Military carries out its operation. The Domain of the operation, e.g., military, intelligence. The Goal of the operation. The location of the operation.

frame_definition: Some entity (Theme) starts out in one place (Source) and ends up in some other place (Goal), having covered some space between the two (Path).
role_definitions: The Theme is the entity that changes location. Note that it is not necessarily a self-mover. The Source is the location the Theme occupies initially before its change of location. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Theme travels or to a landmark by which the Theme travels. The Goal is the location the Theme ends up in. Area identifies the setting in which the Theme's movement takes place without a specified Path. Distance is any expression which characterizes the extent of the Motion. This role is used for the Speed at which the Theme moves. The Carrier is the means of conveyance of the Theme. This role identifies the Duration of time for which the Motion takes place. This role identifies the Time when the Motion occurs. This role identifies the Manner in which the Motion takes place. Result identifies the ultimate effect of the Motion. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of the Theme while the motion is occuring. The Place is the general area in which a specific motion (with Source, Path, or Goal) occurs. The extent to which the Theme cross a boundary as it moves away from a Source region or into a Goal region. This role is used for expressions that indicate motion along a line from the deitic center towards a reference point (which may be implicit) that is neither the Goal of the posture change nor a landmark along the way of the moving part of the body. Often Direction is defined with reference to the canonical orientation of the Protagonist, or the orientation imposed by an implicit observer. In cases wherein the Theme is construed as a sentient entity, this role denotes the state of affairs that the entity wishes to bring about by moving. The shape of the overall Path travelled by the Theme. An event that the described motion forms an integral part of. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.

frame_definition: In this frame a Theme moves in a certain Direction which is often determined by gravity or other natural, physical forces.
role_definitions: This role identifies the general Area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. This role identifies any Depictive phrase describing the the state of the Theme during the motion. Distance identifies a phrase that characterizes the extent of motion of the Theme. Duration is used for the length of time for which the Motion takes place. The Goal is the location the Theme ends up in (often unintentionally). This role identifies the Manner in which the Motion takes place. Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Theme travels or to a landmark past which the Theme travels. This role identifies the Speed at which the motion occurs. This role identifies the Time when the Motion occurs. The Carrier is the means of conveyance of the Theme. The Theme is the entity that changes location. The Source is the location the Theme occupies before the Motion occurs. This role identifies the Result of the motion. This role identifies the Place where motion specified by Source, Path or Goal occurs. The extent to which the Theme crosses boundary as it enters a Goal region or exits a Source region. This role is used for expressing some part of the Theme participant that makes contact with a horizontal surface. The shape formed by the path followed by the Theme. An event whereby the motion of the Theme comes about. The direction of motion of the Theme. Direction characterizes the Path of motion according to some system of orientation, most often that imposed by gravity. Any state of affairs or event from which the particular direction motion logically follows. The state of affairs that the agentive Theme hopes to bring about by moving in a particular direction. The state of the world as the action occurs.

frame_definition: An Influencing_entity, an Influencing_situation, or an Influencing_variable has an influence on a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or a Dependent_variable. '' Compare to Subjective_influence.
role_definitions: A thing or person whose behavior has an effect on an Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. An entity, usually a thing, that is influenced in its behavior by an Influencing_entity or an Influencing_situation. A scalar variable (with unspecified value) which has an effect on the Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. A situation that whose temporal or other characteristics are influenced by an Influencing_entity, Influencing_situation, or Influencing_variable. A scalar variable, whose value depends on the behavior of an Influencing_entity, a Influencing_situation, or an Influencing_variable. A situation whose temporal or other characteristics have an effect on a Dependent_entity, Dependent_situation, or Dependent_variable. The Degree to which the Influencing_entity effects the Dependent_entity. The Time at which the influence occurs. The location at which the influencing occurs. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Influencing_entity that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
