Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. A Descriptor gives additional information about the influence. It may be affecting, as with 'positive impact on GDP'; or not, as in 'potential (or possible) influence of SSRIs on metabolism'. Descriptors are typically adjective phrases.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe motion involving a Vehicle and someone who controls it, the Driver.
role_definitions: This is the being, typically human, that controls the Vehicle as it moves. This is the means of conveyance controlled by the Driver. It may move in any way or medium. With verbs, Vehicle is usually expressed as Object: Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path. This includes directional expressions and 'middle of path'' expressions, e.g.: Any expression which tells where the moving object(s) ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal. Some particles imply the existence of a Goal which is understood in the context of utterance. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, and other things count as Manner expressions. Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance. This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Locative setting adjuncts of motion expressions may also be assigned this frame element. The state of the Driver or Vehicle during the Transportation. An event that the Driver is also participating in while directing the Vehicle. The action performed by the Driver by which the Driver achieves directed Transportation. Result of the Driver's action. This is a second moving object, expressed as a PP headed by with. The Speed is the rate at which the Vehicle moves. The Route is the road or path that the Vehicle regularly travels on. This role indicates the Circumstances under which the operation of the Vehicle takes place. The Place describes the location of a more specific motion (which has Source, Path or Goal). The length of the time interval during which the Driver operates the Vehicle. The Time when the Driver operates the Vehicle The extent to which the Vehicle crosses a boundary or the extent to which the Vehicle completes a course. The state-of-affairs that the Driver tries to bring about by the way that they direct the Vehicle. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. The reason for which the Operate_vehicle event occurs. 'How often' the Operate_vehicle event occurs.

frame_definition: An Operator manipulates the substructure of a System such that the System performs the function it was created for.
role_definitions: The entity that the Operator gets to perform its intended function. The invididual who manipulates the substructure of the System. This role identifies the place where the Operator runs the System. This role identifies the purpose for which an Operator runs the System. This role identifies the time when the Operator runs the System. This role identifies the Means by which an Operator runs the System. Any description of the running of the System which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Operator that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). Duration denotes the length of the time interval in which the Operator runs the System.

frame_definition: An Experiencer feels an emotion as evoked as an Other.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is the person or sentient entity that experiences or feels the emotions. The Other is the person that evokes the emotional response in the Experiencer. The extent to which the Experiencer's emotion deviates from the norm for the emotion. The Explanation is the explanation for why the Other evokes a certain emotional response. The Circumstances is the condition(s) under which the Other evokes its response. The Parameter is a domain in which the Experiencer experiences the feelings of the Other. Any description of the way in which the Experiencer experiences the feelings of the Other which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Manner may also describe a state of the Experiencer that affects the details of the emotional experience. The Time when the Experiencer feels for the Other. The Situation is the circumstances or topic about which the Experiencer feels an emotion. How often the Other gets sympathy from the Experiencer.

frame_definition: An Authority excuses an Offense that an Offender has committed, with the effect of ending or preventing any punishment.
role_definitions: This role denotes the offender that seeks or gets the pardon. Authority is the organization or person taht grants the pardon. This role denotes the the illegal act that the Offender is pardoned for. Explanation is the cause for pardoning an Offender. This role denotes the time when the pardon is given An intentional action performed by the Authority that accomplishes the pardon. Any description of the act of pardon which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of an Authority that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The location at which the pardoning takes place. An action that the Authority intends to accomplish by pardoning

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe situations in which a Perpetrator forcibly seizes control over a Victim's Vehicle to gain some end. ''
role_definitions: This is the person (or other agent) who forcibly seizes control over a vehicle to gain some end. This is the means of transportation which gets under the control of the perpetrator. Example: The terrorists hijacked the plane. This role describes the people that are suffering as a result of the Perpetrator's action. Degree to which event occurs The unlawful seizure of a Vehicle by a Perpetrator. Manner of performing an action An act performed by the Perpetrator by which the seizure of the Vehicle is accomplished. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. Where the event takes place. When the event occurs. This is the place to which the vehicle is directed. This is the place from which the vehicle is taken away. The action that the Perpetrator is trying to accomplish by piracy. The situation that the Perpetrator had in mind which lead to the decision to perpetrate the particular act of piracy. An object that the Perpetrator uses in taking control of the Vehicle. The number of times that the Vehicle is seized in acts of piracy.

frame_definition: Generally without overall (translational) motion, an Agent places a Theme at a location, the Goal, which is profiled.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move. The Theme is the object that changes location during the Placing. The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it changes location. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path. In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense. The role Goal is the location where the Theme ends up. This role is profiled by words in this frame. Any expression which describes a property of the placing action which is not directly related to the trajectory of the Theme's motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. The Degree indicates the degree to which the placing occurs. This role identifies any Depictive phrase describing the Agent or Theme of the placing. The Means is an act whereby the Agent achieves the placing of the Theme. This role identifies the Result of the Placing. The Duration is the amount of time for which the Theme is to stay in the Goal location. The Place indicates where the Placing occurs. The Explanation indicates why the Placing occurs. Time is when the Placing occurs The Area is the setting into which the Theme is placed. This is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique. This role is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion. The Speed is the rate at which Placing occurs.  An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by perform the placing action. This extrathematic role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.

frame_definition: An Agent behaves as if they were a particular individual or type of Simulated_entity with the intent of misleading observers of their behavior.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person who acts in a misleading way to create the impression that they are a particular individual or type of Simulated_entity. Any description of the posing event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including general descriptions comparing events (the same way) and salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly). An intentional action performed by the Agent that contributes to the his or her being perceived as a particular (kind of) Simulated_entity. The type or individual that the Agent gives the impression of being. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by posing as a particular (kind of) Simulated_entity. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the posing event logically follows. The location where the Agent gives the impression that they are the Simulated_entity. The time at which the Agent impersonates the Simulated_entity.

frame_definition: An Agent enacts an Action that is intended to be performed again at one or more later Occasions.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Action that the Agent performs intentionally in order to prepare for a later Occasion. The Agent performs the Action in preparation for later performances of the same type. This role identifies the place where the practicing occurs. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent performs an intentional act. This role identifies the time when the Agent practices. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent practices. Any description of the practicing which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the Action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The later enactment or enactments that the Agent expects to perform. Note that the Agent does not have to have specific Occasions in mind. The period of time during which an Action is repeatedly practiced. The number of times that the Action is practiced. A person who participates in a practice event along with the Agent.

frame_definition: Water in some solid or liquid form (the Precipitation) falls from the sky at a particular Place and Time, lasting for a particular Duration.
role_definitions: The water in liquid or solid form that falls from the sky is the Precipitation. This role is incorporated in many LUs in this frame. The Quantity of Precipitation that falls within a certain Duration. The Quantity is the amount of Precipitation that has fallen in a precipitation event or events. It is usually measured as the height that the Precipitation attains if prevented from further movement. The area which experiences precipitation. The amount of time for which the precipitation event lasts. When the event occurs. The Explanation is the reason for the precipitation event. The way in which the precipitation falls. This role identifies the temperature of the precipitation. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.

frame_definition: An Experiencer is in an undesirable Situation, whose Explanation may also be expressed.
role_definitions: The Experiencer is in an undesirable Situation. This role identifies the undesirable Situation the Experiencer is in. This role identifies the Explanation of the Situation. Thiis role identifies the Time when the Situation is in effect. The location where the Situation occurs. The Domain in which the Experiencer has the problem.

frame_definition: An Entity exists at a particular Location, at a particular Time, as observed by an implicit observer.
role_definitions: The Entity whose existence at the Location is confirmed. The Location of the Entity. The Location is conceived as a ground for an event of inspection to determine the presense of the Entity. The time when the Entity is present at the Location. A separate description of the state of the Entity when it is present. The time period during which the Entity is present. In this frame, Duration may be expressed with for preceding an event which stands for the duration of the event. In cases where the Entity is sentient, there may be an inference that the Entity's intent is to be present so as to participate in the event. The purpose of the Entity. A characterization of the presence or absence of the Entity. The degree to which the Entity is present.

frame_definition: In this frame an Agent preserves a Patient in order to prevent it from decaying.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act that leads to the preservation. Medium is the substance in which the Patient might be submerged to be preserved. The Patient is organic matter that undergoes the preservation. The Instrument with which an an Agent performs the Preserving. The Means by which the Agent preserves the Patient. The Manner in which the Agent preserves the Patient. The Place where the preserving occurs. The Time when the Agent preserves the Patient. The Purpose for which the Agent preserves the Patient. Result of an action. The amount of Time for which the process of Preserving is ongoing. The Depictive phrase describing one of the participants. The extent to which the Patient is preserved from decaying.

frame_definition: A Process is finished and can no longer proceed.
role_definitions: Where the event takes place. This role identifies the name of the Process that occurs. When the event occurs.

frame_definition: An Event continues at a certain Place through Time.
role_definitions: Depictive phrase about the state of a focal participant. Manner in which the Event is continuing. This role identifies the Duration of time over which the Event is ongoing. Name of the Event which is continuing. Where the Event takes place. The Explanation for which the Event occurs. When the Event occurs. The Next_subevent of the overall Event. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role signifies that the state of affairs expressed by the main clause (containing the target) occurs or holds, and something other than that state of affairs would be expected given the state of affairs in the concessive clause.

frame_definition: A Process comes to an end.
role_definitions: Name of the event which occurs. The Final_subevent of an event. Where the event takes place. The Explanation for which the event ends. When the event ends. Degree to which the event occurs. Depictive phrase describing the actor of the event. Manner of performing the event. Result for the event. The number of times that the event is repeated. The amount of time it takes for the Process to end.

frame_definition: An Event begins at a certain Time and Place.
role_definitions: Name of the Event which occurs. Where the Event takes place. The Explanation for which an Event occurs. When the Event occurs. The Initial_subevent of the Event. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action. Manner in which an action is performed. Result of the Event. The period of time for which the Process is ongoing after it has started. The number of times that the specified type of Event begins.

frame_definition: A Process stops at a certain Time and Place.
role_definitions: The Process which is halting. Where the event takes place. This role identifies the Explanation of an event occur. When the event occurs. Degree to which the event occurs. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action. Manner of performing an action. The Result of an event. The Final_subevent of an event. The amount of time that a process remains stopped. The number of times that the Process stops.,

frame_definition: The number of entities that make up the Set changes from an Initial_number to a Final_number.
role_definitions: The Attribute is the number of entities that make up the Set. The group of entities, possibly construed as a collective, whose number changes. The number of entities by which the Set increases or decreases. Any expression that gives information about points on the number scale that the Set traverses between the starting and ending point of its movement. The number of entities in the Set afterwards. The initial number of entities in the Set. The rate of change of the value. The Correlated_variable is an ordered progression of positions or values (most often a sequence of spatial locations) that the (dependent) Attribute is measured against. The Correlated_variable is metaphorically mapped onto the progression of time, and in the absence of this FE, changes in the number in the Setare simply measured against (forward-directional) time. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Degree to which event occurs. The Circumstances under which the proliferation takes place. The Group within which the number of entities in the Set changes in the specified way. The Time is the time-frame in which the change in number occurs. The length of time over which the change takes place. The value, location, or state-of-affairs that corresponds to the Initial_number of entities in the Set. The value, location, or state-of-affairs that corresponds to the Final_number in the Set. A location where the Set changes in number. A description that presents the Set's state before the change in the number of entities making it up as an independent predication. A description that presents the Set's state after the change in the Attribute's value as an independent predication.

frame_definition: An Employee voluntarily leaves the service of an Employer.
role_definitions: The person who is obligated to perform some task in order to receive compensation. The person (or institution) in whose employ the Employee stood. The Field that one works in. This role identifies the Manner in which an Employee leaves the job. This role identifies the place where the Employee quits the employment of the Employer. The label given to a particular type of service that the employer quits. This role identifies the purpose for which an Employee quits the employment of the Employer. This role identifies the Time when an Employee quits the employment of the Employer. The Explanation for which the Employee quits. The means whereby the act of quitting is accomplished

frame_definition: A Self_mover leaves an initial Source location.
role_definitions: This is the entity which moves under its own power. Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. A relation to a landmark that describes the trajectory in the midst of the motion. (It is thus neither a Source nor the Intended_goal.) Any expression which tells where the Self_mover intends to end up as a result of the motion. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. An event involving the Self_mover that results in the Self_mover moving in the specified way. The Speed is the rate at which the Self_mover moves. A second moving object that moves in coordination with the Self_mover. The state of the Self_mover during the action. The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located. The configuration formed by the entire Path of the Self_mover, taken simultaneously. The direction in which the Self_mover goes. The time at which the motion takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Self_mover wishes to bring about. The device or bodypart that serves to move the Self_mover. The length of time that the Self_mover spends away from the Source. The state of the Self_mover at the end of the event. A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the Self_mover. An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, Reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, and/or is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of departure and which the departure is taken to be a part of. The number of times that an action occurs in a given time. A larger conceptualization that includes the departing as an integral part. The departure expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Self_mover), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the departing. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the departing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole. The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event (it does not allow states) that the departing is rhythmically aligned with. (This would then further require that the departing be iterated.) The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event. The distance from the Source that the Self_mover ends up.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe situations in which the Perpetrator has sexual intercourse with the Victim forcibly (or by threatening the use of force) and without his or her consent. ''
role_definitions: This is the person who forces another person to have sexual intercourse with him or her against the other person's will. This is the person who is forced to engage in sexual intercourse against his or her will. Degree to which event occurs The rape of a Victim by the Perpetrator. Manner of performing an action An act performed by the Perpetrator by which the sexual crime is accomplished. Result of an event The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. Where the event takes place. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. The Time when the event occurs. This role is any object used to commit the crime.  The number of times that a rape event takes place.

frame_definition: A Speaker conveys a Message to an Experiencer in order to reassure them about a Situation; Medium and the Means of the communication also may be expressed.
role_definitions: The sentient entity that uses language in the written or spoken modality to reassure another person. The Experiencer receives reassurance from the Speaker. The Message is a proposition or set of propositions that the Speaker wants the Experiencer to believe in order to feel reassured. The Situation is the problem plaguing the Experiencer, about which the Speaker reassures them. The physical or abstract setting in which the Message is conveyed. The amount of reassurance given. The Depictive describes the state of the Speaker. The Manner in which the Speaker reassures the Experiencer. The Means by which the Speaker reassures the Experiencer. The Time at which the reassurance takes place.

frame_definition: A Recipient comes into possession of the Theme as a result of the joint action of the Donor and the Recipient.
role_definitions: The person who acts to come into possession of the Theme. The person who gives the Theme to the Recipient. The entity that changes possession, beginning in the possession of the Donor and ending up with the Recipient. The aim of the Donor, which they believe will be accomplished by giving the Theme. The act that the Recipient performs which brings about their reception of the Theme. The time at which the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme. The location at which the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme. The system whereby the Theme travels (literally or metaphorically) so that the Recipient comes into possession of the Theme. The state of the Recipient or Theme during the action. The character of the Recipient which saliently affects the action, or a general description of the action itself. A good given or a service rendered by the Recipient, in return for wich the Theme is given to the Recipient by the Donor. When the Theme is received physically by the Recipient from the Donor, the Path of motion of the Theme may be specified. What the Recipient intends to do with the Theme. A role that the Theme is intended to fill by the Donor.

frame_definition: The action of an Agent or the occurrence of a Cause event returns an Entity to an earlier state of vigor and strength.
role_definitions: The concrete or abstract thing that is brought into an earlier state in which it was more effective and powerful. The Agent puts the Entity into a state of renewed vigor. This role identifies the place where the Agent brings about the change in the Entity's state. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent brings about the revitalization of the Entity. This role identifies the time when the Agent causes the renewal of the Entity. This role identifies the action that the Agent performs in order so as to bring about the reinvigoration of the Entity. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Domain within which the Entity is affected. The number of times that an Entity is caused to return to a more effective state. An event or state whose occurrence brings about the Entity's return to a vigorous state. This role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole, either appraisals of the event, or descriptions of the rejuvenation event as role fillers in other frames. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. The device used by the Agent to help accomplish the action indicated by the target. Role is used for the capacity in which the Entity is Rejuvinated, and is expressed in as-PPs. The end state of the Rejuvination action.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Theme to move away from a location, the Source.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person (or other force) that causes the Theme to move. Theme is the object that changes location. The Source is the initial location of the Theme, before it changes location. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal expresses the frame element Path. In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense. The Goal is the location where the Theme ends up. This Frame Element is not profiled by words in this frame, though it may occasionally be expressed, as with the word remove. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. The Means is an act whereby the Agent achieves the removal. Result of an event Degree to which event occurs The non-Agentive cause of the removing event. The Distance is any expression which characterizes the extent of motion. This frame element occurs throughout the motion domain but is very infrequent in Motion_Noise. The Means_of_motion expresses the conveyance with which the Agent effects the motion of the Theme. The Means_of_motion holds and conveys the Theme. Means_of_motions can move in any way and in any medium. They are usually expressed obliquely with 'in' or 'by'. The Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique. The time at which the removal takes place. The location where the removal takes place. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. The tool the Agent uses to remove the Theme from its Source. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. An event the punctuates the larger Removing event. The state of the world when the Agent or Cause removes the Theme from the Source. To what end the Agent or Cause removes the Theme. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role is used to indicate the Direction that the Theme travels when it is removed.

frame_definition: An Agent affects an Artifact so that it is no longer capable of performing its inherent function.
role_definitions: The sentient entity causes the Artifact to not function. The device that no longer works. An event that the Agent hopes to bring about by breaking an Artifact. The action that the Agent performs which results in the Artifact being inoperable. An inanimate entity or force that renders the Artifact non-functional. The time at which the event takes place. The place at which the event takes place. A holistic description of the event (e.g. the same way), including depictions of the Agent in terms of how the state of the Agent affects the overall action (e.g maliciously). Meaning: This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs--Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. Degree to which event occurs The length of time that the Artifact is (or has been) rendered nonfunctional. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describing the state of particpant while lack of functionality is being rendered.

frame_definition: A Lessee gains the use of Goods owned by a Lessor by payment to the Lessor.
role_definitions: The individual that gains temporary use of the Goods by paying the Lessor The role Goods is an item which is temporarily exchanged for Money in a transaction. The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Money is the thing given in exchange for tempory use of the Goods. In isome cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. The individual who has permanent ownership of the Goods and allows them to be used by the Lessee temporarily. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. The location the renting takes place. The purpose for which the renting is performed. A state-of-affairs from which the renting logically follows. When the event occurs. Any description of the purchasing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Lessee that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The individual intended by the Lessee to receive the Goods. The length of time that the Goods are (or have been) in the Lessee's possession. The Lessee's intended purpose for the Goods.

frame_definition: A Lessor who owns some Goods allows a Lessee to use the Goods temporarily in exchange for Money.
role_definitions: The Lessee has Money and wants the Goods. The role Goods is the item which is temporarily exchanged for Money. The means by which a commercial transaction occurs. Money is the thing given in exchange for Goods in a transaction. In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. The Lessor has possession of the Goods and temporarily exchanges them for Money from a Lessee. This role is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a by-PP. The location where the leasing takes place. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. A state-of-affairs from which the renting logically follows. The time at which the renting takes place. Any description of the renting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Lessor that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The state of the Lessor after the sale has occurred. The length of time that the Goods are (or have been) in the Lessee's possession. The Lessee's intended purpose for the Goods. This role indicates that the selling act reverses an earlier separate act in which the current Lessor rented or bought the Goods from the current Lessee. This role indicates that the current leasing constitues a re-lease by the current Lessor of Goods that they bought or rented earlier from a third person (not the Lessee of the current leasing act).

frame_definition: An Agent changes the filler of a Role by placing a New filler in the position after the Old filler ceases to occupy the position.
role_definitions: An intentional action performed by the Agent that accomplishes the replacement. The conscious entity, generally a person, that performs actions resulting in the New entity occupying the position. An entity directed by the Agent that interacts with an New entity so that it ends up in the position. This role identifies where the Agent installs the New entity. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent places the New entity in a position. This role identifies the time when the Agent installs the New entity. The New entity is the person or thing that the Agent sets to fill a Role. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics or states of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in placing the New filler in a position. The extent to which the New entity is affected by the Agent. Degrees of replacement are generally only possible when there are multiple New and Old entities. The entity that formerly occupied the position. The category that the New and Old entities fit into as a result of the function they serve.

frame_definition: An Agent saves a Patient or an Asset from a Harmful_situation.
role_definitions: The sentient being who rescues the Patient or Asset from the Harmful_situation. The living being who is rescued by the Agent. The entity that is judged to be valueable which might be lost or damaged by the Harmful_situation. An event that occurs which could result in injury or harm to the Patient or Asset. The time at which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset. The way in which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset. The location at which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset. The setting in which the rescuing act takes place. The tool with which the Agent saves the Patient or Asset. The means by which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset. The purpose for which the Agent rescues the Patient or Asset. A state of affairs that the Agent is responding to in performing the action. The extent to which the Patient or Asset is actually saved.

frame_definition: In this frame a Deformer deforms a Patient possibly against a Resistant_surface such that it undergoes a shape-change from its canonical or original shape into the Configuration, a new shape.
role_definitions: The Deformer is the one who does the reshaping. This role identifies the Instrument with which the Deformer affects the Patient. The role Manner identifies the manner in which an Deformer intentionally affects the Patient. The role Means identifies the means by which the Deformer intentionally affects the Patient. The Patient is the entity acted on and that undergoes a change. The Place indicates where the Deformer intentionally affects the Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which the Deformer intentionally affects the Patient. The role Time identifies when the Deformer intentionally affects the Patient. The Result is the shape the Patient becomes. The Resistant_surface is the surface against which a Deformer presses the Patient. The Locus is the locus of the reshaping action; it is essentially a simultaneous Instrument and Resistant_surface. The Cause is an animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of Causes. The role Iterations indicates the number of times the reshaping has occurred. The Explanation indicates a state of affairs that the Deformer is responding to in performing the reshaping. The degree to which the Patient is reshaped. The part of the Patient which is directly affected by the reshaping. The location that the Patient ends up in. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The conditions under which the Patient is shaped. The state of the Patient with respect to the change that the Deformer brings about by making the adjustment. A state that holds of the Patient or a relation that holds among the constituent parts of the Patient as a result of the arranging action.

frame_definition: An Agent resolves an outstanding Problem by finding its solution, explanation, answer, etc.
role_definitions: The Agent finds the solution or explanation to the outstanding mystery or Problem. The Problem is the predicament or mystery that is resolved. The Cause is the non-Agentive event or state of affairs that brings about the resolution of the Problem. The Means is an intermediate action taken by the Agent in order to resolve the Problem. This role indicates the Time at which the Problem is resolved. This role indicates the location at which the Problem is resolved. The Degree to which the Agent or Cause resolves the problem. Any description of the resolution, such as secondary effects ( quietly ) or comparisons of events ( the same way ). In agentive cases, Manner may also describe salient characteristics of the Agent which affect the action. ( carefully, dilligently, deliberately etc. ) The Resultant_situation is any situation which arises as a result of resolving a Problem . The Outcome is the failure or success of resolving a Problem . The Containing_event denotes an event or state of affairs that occurs or holds at a time that includes the time during which the resolution of the Problem occurs. Some specification of the circumstances under which the Problem is resolved. The Instrument is an entity used for resolving the Problem . This role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the resolution of a Problem . This role identifies the length of time taken to resolve a Problem . The government resolved the beach ball crisis in just 22 hours. Role is used for the capacity in which the Agent resolves a Problem or the role of the Problem in being resolved, and is expressed in as-PPs. Frequency describes how often the Agent or Cause resolves this problem. This role identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the Problem is resolved. A person who participates in resolving a Problem along with the Agent. The state of affairs that the Agent is trying to bring about by solving the Problem in the specified way.

frame_definition: An Agent performs a Response action in consequence of a Trigger event.
role_definitions: The means action whereby the Agent responds to the Trigger. A non-agentive entity that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond. An event that impinges upon the Agent or Responding_entity and produces a Response from it. The point in time when the Agent or Responding_entity manifests its Response to the Trigger . A characterization of the Responding_entity, Agent, or their Response action. The location in which the Response action takes place. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by performing the Response action. The intentional Agent that is impinged upon by a Trigger event to which they respond. A particular feature of the Responding_entity or Agent that is involved in the Response action. The capacity of of the Agent is their Response act.

frame_definition: This frame concerns the infliction of punishment in return for a wrong suffered.
role_definitions: The Avenger exacts revenge from the Offender for the Injury. This role identifies the Degree to which an event occurs. Depictive identifies a phrase describing the actor of an action. The Offender has committed the earlier Injury for which the Avenger seeks revenge. This role identifies the Instrument with which the revenge is performed. This frame element refers to the Manner in which the Avenger exacts their revenge from the Offender. The Avenger carries out a Punishment in order to exact revenge on the Offender. This role identifies the Place where the revenge occurs. This role identifies the Purpose for which the revenge is performed. The Injury is the injurious action committed by the Offender against the Injured_Party. This Frame Element need not always be realized, although it is conceptually necessary. This role identifies the Result of inflicting punishment for a wrong suffered. This role identifies the Time when the revenge occurs. This frame element identifies the constituent that encodes who or what suffered the Injury at the hands of the Offender. Sometimes, an abstract concept such a person's honour or their blood is presented as the element that has suffered the Injury. These also constitute instances of Injured_party The length of time that the Avenger seeks revenge for the Injury.

frame_definition: An Agent (the punisher or rewarder) performs a Response_action on an Evaluee for a Reason, the Evaluee's actions or beliefs.
role_definitions: Evaluee is the person or thing about whom/which a judgment has made and to whom reward/punishment is dealt. With verbs, the Evaluee is typically expressed as Object. Manner of performing the reward or punishment. The action that is taken that results in punishement/reward. Typically, there is a constituent expressing the Reason for the Agent's judgment. It is usually a 'for'-PP, e.g. Result of the reward or punishment. Where the event takes place. When the event occurs. The Agent is the person doing the rewarding or punishing. The Instrument with which the reward or punishment is carried out. The Purpose of the reward or punishment. The reward or punishment given to the Evaluee by the Agent. Degree of reward or punishment. Depictive phrase describing the Agent of the reward or punishment.

frame_definition: In this frame a Patient, which is an organic substance, undergoes the natural process of decaying from an Initial_state to a Result.
role_definitions: The Patient is the entity that undergoes a change. The Place is where the rotting occurs. The Time indicates when the rotting occurs. The Explanation indicates the reason for which the Patient rots. The Result is the result of the change of phase of the Patient. The Initial_state is the original state of the Patient. The Duration indicates the amount of time for which the Patient rots. The Speed is the rate at which the Patient changes. The Subregion describes which part of a larger whole is being affected. The Degree expressions that indicate to what degree the Patient has changed. The number of times that a rotting event takes place. Any description of the Rotting event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (horribly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). A state of affairs that entails the Patient decaying.

frame_definition: A Cognizer_agent attempts to find some Sought_entity by examining some Ground.
role_definitions: The person who attempts to find the Sought_entity. This is the entity to which the Cognizer_agent pays attention. It is referred to as Ground because it serves as the background or context for the Sought_entity. This role can be expressed as an NP Object (first example) or as a PP Complement (second example). This is the entity that the Ground may contain. Typically, it is expressed as a for-PP. The Manner of performing an action. An act of the Cognizer_agent that allows them to look for the Sought_entity. The failure or success of an attempt. A spatial setting larger than the Ground in which the Seeking event occurs. This role identifies the Time when the Seeking occurs. An action that the Cognizer_agent intends to accomplish by performing the search. This role identifies the amount of effort put into an attempt.

frame_definition: An Agent intends and takes steps towards bringing about a State_of_affairs or, metonymically, towards acquiring a Sought_entity .
role_definitions: The Agent makes an attempt to achieve a State_of_affairs or to obtain a Sought_entity. The entity that the Agent attempts to acquire. The Outcome is the failure or success of an attempt to acquire a Sought_entity. This role identifies the Means by which an attempt at achieving a State_of_affairs or at acquiring the Sought_entity is made. This role identifies the amount of effort put into an attempt. This role identifies the Time when the attempt occurs. The Depictive is a phrase which describes the Agent. The place where the Agent is seeking to achieve a particular State_of_affairs or to acquire a Sought_entity. The Manner in which the Agent makes the attempt. The time period over which the attempts at achieving a State_of_affairs or acquiring the Sought_entity take place. An action that the Agent intends to accomplish by bringing about a particular State_of_affairs or acquiring the Sought_entity. A state or event that the Agent wants to bring about. The Agent may but need not be a participant in that State_of_affairs. A proposition from which the occurrence of the seeking event follows. An individual or organization that helps the Agent bring about the State_of_affairs or delivers the Sought_entity to the Agent. This role introduces the underlying situation(s) in which seeking occurs. This role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the Sought_entity or State_of_affairs .

frame_definition: The Self_mover, a living being, moves under its own direction along a Path.
role_definitions: Self_mover is the living being which moves under its own power. Normally it is expressed as an external argument. Source is used for any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. Path is used for any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal. This includes 'middle of path'' expressions. Goal is used for any expression which tells where the Self_mover ends up as a result of the motion. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory or rate of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance. Area is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Note that this role should not be used for cases when the same phrase could be used with the same meaning with a non-motion target, since these should be annotated with the Place FE. The time when the motion occurs. An entity whose motion is correlated with that of the Self_mover, following and tracking the Self_mover, being followed and tracked, or with both parties mutually matching Paths. The rate at which the location of the Self_mover changes with respect to time. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action An act whereby the Self_mover achieves movement. Result of an event The emotional or mental state of the Self_mover which motivates them toward motion or the particular manner of motion. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. This role identifies the purpose for which a Self_mover moves. The Place is the location within which a defined motion takes place. Any specified or implied Source, Path or Goal should designate a location contained with the Place. This role can be differentiated from Area by the fact that the annotated phrase can be used in the same meaning with non-motion targets. The state of affairs that leads to the particular motion that the Self_mover adopts. External_cause is something in the external environment that causes the Self_mover to move. The direction that the Self_mover heads in during the motion. The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event-it does not allow states-that the Traversing is rhythmically aligned with. The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event. The shape of the overall Path travelled by the Self_mover. An event or circumstance that would not be expected given the nature of the particular Self_motion event.

frame_definition: These words refer to separating a Whole into Parts, or separating one part from another.
role_definitions: The Whole is a single entity or an aggregate of entities which is separated into Parts. It is usually the NP Object of a target verb. This refers collectively to the Parts resulting from separation of a Whole: Part-1 is the first of two Parts mentioned. This is most often the Object of a verb. Part_2 is the second of two Parts mentioned. This is usually a PP Complement. First, With causative uses of these verbs, an Agent separates or divides something. The Agent is usually expressed as the External Argument: This frame element expresses a property of the Parts or components of the Whole which is used as the basis for separation. Criterion is typically expressed as a PP headed by by, or as a complex PP of the form on the basis of.... This role identifies any Depictive phrase describing the Agent who separates or the undergoers of the separation. Manner of performing an action Degree to which event occurs An act of the Agent that accomplishes the separation. This role identifies the Result of an event. The Cause is the non-agent that brings about the separation. The Recipients are the groups who come into possession of the Parts of the Whole. This role identifies the Time when the separation occurs. Where the separation occurs. The Instrument used to cause the separation. The Agent's intent for separating the Whole.

frame_definition: This frame describes either the creation of a Flame by a Kindler or non-sentient Cause, or the igniting of Flammables by a Kindler or a Cause.
role_definitions: The Kindler is the person performing the intentional act. The Flame is what is created by the Kindler. The Flamables is the the object that is set on fire by the Kindler. The cause of the fire. This role identifies the Time when the event occurs. This role identifies the Place where the event takes place. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of a Kindler that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An event brought about by the Cause or the Kindler that actually makes the Flammables catch fire. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. This role describes the Kindler as being in some state during the action.

frame_definition: A Self_mover begins a journey at a Source location, in a particular Directiongenerally setting out with an Intended_goal in mind.
role_definitions: This is the entity which moves under its own power. Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. A relation to a landmark that describes the trajectory in the midst of the motion. (It is thus neither a Source nor the Intended_goal.) Any expression which tells where the Self_mover intends to end up as a result of the motion. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. An event involving the Self_mover that results in the Self_mover moving in the specified way. The Speed is the rate at which the Self_mover moves. A second moving object which the Self_mover moves to follow. The state of the Self_mover during the action. The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located. The configuration formed by the entire Path of the Self_mover, taken simultaneously. The direction in which the Self_mover goes. The time at which the motion takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Self_mover wishes to bring about. The device or bodypart that serves to move the Self_mover. The length of time that the Self_mover spends away from the Source. The state of the Self_mover at the end of the event. A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the Self_mover. An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, Reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, and/or is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time of departure and which the departure is taken to be a part of. The number of times that an action occurs in a given time. A larger conceptualization that includes the departing as an integral part. The departure expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Self_mover), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the departing. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the departing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole. The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event (it does not allow states) that the departing is rhythmically aligned with. (This would then further require that the departing be iterated.) The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event. The distance from the Source that the Self_mover ends up.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge which induces the rapid motion of the Projectile.
role_definitions: The device used by the Agent to cause the motion of the Projectile. The entity whose rapid, dangerous motion is caused by the Agent and/or Firearm. The Agent is the person performing the intentional act causing the motion of the Projectile. This role is any expression characterizing the extent of motion of the Theme. Pat threw the Javelin 50 meters. This role is the point at which the Theme ends up as a result of the motion. Kim threw the cat into the garden. Manner of performing an action An act of the Agent whereby the rapid motion of the Projectile is achieved. This role is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor Goal. I pushed the trolley along the street. This role is the starting point of motion. Pat dragged the box out of the cupboard. Degree to which event occurs A description of the state of the Agent or Projectile during the event. This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular or not to consist of a single, linear path. Locative setting adjuncts may also be assigned this frame element. Kim pushed the lawnmower around the garden. The location in which the shooting event takes place. The Time when the shooting event takes place. The Agent's purpose in launching the Projectile

frame_definition: A Shopper looks for Goods in order to purchase them.
role_definitions: The person who attempts to find the Goods. This is the entity to which the Cognizer pays attention. It is referred to as the Ground because it serves as the background or context for the Goods. This role is usually expressed as a preposition phrase. This is the entity that the Ground may contain. Typically, it is expressed as afor-PP. The Manner in which the shopping action is done. An act of the Shopper that allows them to look for (and perhaps purchase) the Goods. The failure or success of an attempt. A spatial setting larger than the Ground in which the Shopping event occurs. This role identifies the time when the shopping occurs. An action that the Shopper intends to accomplish by performing the search. This role identifies the amount of effort put into shopping. This role describes a participant of shopping scenario as being in some state during the action. The Co-participant is an entity that participates in a coordinated way in the shopping event with the Shopper.

frame_definition: A Signatory signs an Agreement document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the Agreement.
role_definitions: The signatory of the Agreement. The entity signifying the identity of the Signatory, resulting from the act of writing on the Agreement document. An expression of the state of the Signatory at the time of signing. An entity directed by the Signatory that interacts with the Agreement document so as to produce the Signature. The place where the signing occurs. Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Signatory that also affect the action (happily, eagerly). This role identifies the action whereby the Signatory achieves the signing of the Agreement. The purpose for which the Signatory commits to the Agreement. This role identifies the Time at which signature is given. The Explanation for putting signature to paper. The document which encodes the commitment of the Signatory. The Co-participant signs the Agreement along with the Signatory. his extrathematic role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary. The category of the Signatory in the Sign_agreement event.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Speaker to become silent, sometimes about a particular Topic.
role_definitions: The Agent is the person performing the intentional act. The instrument with which an intentional act is performed. Where the event takes place. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. When the event occurs. An act whereby the Agent silences the Speaker. The sentient entity that is not communicating. This is the subject matter to which the Message pertains. It is typically expressed as a PP Complement headed by about. The Explanation for which an intentional act is performed. The Result is the final state of the Speaker. The Expressor is the Speaker's voice or other communicative noise emitted by the Speaker. Any description of the silencing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The extent to which the Agent succeeds in creating silence.

frame_definition: The words in this frame describe situations in which the Perpetrator secretly takes Goods into or out of a country or other area which are prohibited by law or on which one has not paid the required duty.
role_definitions: This is the person (or other agent) that illegally takes the goods into or out of a country. The role Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be illegally taken into our out of a country. The amount of time for which a state holds or a process is ongoing. Where the event takes place. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. When the event occurs. The source is the location the goods occupy initially before change of location. The path refers to (a part of the) ground the Goods travel over or to a landmark the Goods travel by. Goal is the location the Goods end up in. An act of the Perpetrator which allows them to smuggle the Goods. The unlawful movement of Goods. A description of the Event not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In most cases, it indicates salient characteristics of a Perpetrator that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The action that the Perpetrator is trying to accomplish by the act of smuggling. The number of times that a smuggling event occurs. The container, vehicle, or other entity that the Goods move with and remain stationary with respect to. The distance travelled by the Goods. The amount of time per distance travelled by the Goods.

frame_definition: In this frame, an Agent places the Theme in the Medium for an extended period of time, with the intent that the Theme will be affected by and absorb some of the Medium. '
role_definitions: The Agent is the person performing the soaking. The Theme is the entity that changes location. The amount of time for which the Theme is soaked. The Manner in which the Agent soaks the Theme. Medium is the substance in which the Theme is submerged. This role identifies the Container that holds the Theme which is submerged and the Medium that it is in. The Place where the submerging occurs. The Time when the Agent soaks the Theme. The action of the Agent that brings about the soaking. The situation that the Agent hopes to bring about by soaking the Theme.

frame_definition: An Entity is in a specified State.
role_definitions: The entity whose State is specified and/or evaluated. An assessment or characterization of the Entity's State. A relation in which the Entity participates or a property that the Entity possesses. A subpart or characteristic of the Entity that is in a specified State.

frame_definition: A Speaker succeeds in getting an Addressee to believe or plan to execute the Content the Speaker has in mind.
role_definitions: The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act. The person who intends through the use of language to get another person to act. The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses. A piece of written or spoken material that changes the mind of the Addressee. The general item or items that are the focus of the Content of the Speaker's message. An act of the Speaker that accomplishes the persuasion. Degree to which event occurs The way in which the Speaker suades the Addressee. When the Speaker suades the Addressee. The location where the Speaker suades the Addressee.

frame_definition: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.
role_definitions: The person that begins in possession of the Documents and gives them over into the possession of the Authority for processing. The individual or organization that ends up in possession of the Documents and processes them. The artifacts containing content, typically in the form of text and images, that the Submittor gives to the Authority. The Place where the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which event of the Submittor's giving the Documents to the Authority logically follows. The time period during which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority. The Purpose for which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority. The Means by which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority. The Manner is the manner in which the Submittor gives the Documents to the Authority. The Authority's intended purpose for the Documents. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. This extra-thematic role applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.

frame_definition: An Entity survives a situation with some Support, which tends to be far below the accustomed or standard level expected.
role_definitions: The living organism which requires the Support to survive. The resource that the Entity relies on to survive through a situation. The amount of time that the Entity survives with the help of the Support. The degree to which the Support is responsible for the survival of the Entity.

frame_definition: An Assailant attacks a Victim, intending to die in the process.
role_definitions: This Victim is the being or entity that is injured by the Assailant's suicide attack. An entity used by the Assailant to cause damage to the Victim. The person (or other self-directed entity) that is attempting physical harm to the Victim. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an Assailant that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Assailant that accomplishes the assault. This role identifies the place where the Assailant makes an assault on the Victim. This role identifies the purpose for which an Assailant attacks the Victim. This role identifies the time when the Assailant attacks the Victim. The starting-point of the motion of the Assailant or projectiles of the Assailant as they move toward the the Place that the Victim is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. This role is used for any Depictive phrase describeing the state of the Assailant or Victim while the Attack occurs. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the Re-encoding, but not necessarily. The Result of the attack on the Victim by the Assailant. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The Path refers to (a part of) the ground over which the Assailant travels.

frame_definition: A Communicator processes some information (either from textual or real-world/perceptual sources) regarding a State_of_affairs into a concise form (a summary) that contains the essential content in briefer form, and communicates this summary to an Addressee, or records it in a Medium.
role_definitions: The Communicator creates and communicates the summary of the Information. The Communicator communicates the summary to the Addressee. The State_of_affairs is summarized by the Communicator. The textual or other Medium through which the Communicator summarizes. The content that results from the summarization. The time at which the Communicator makes the Summary. The location where the Communicator communicates. Any description of the details of the action beyond the identity of the participants and the setting, especially descriptions of the Communicator that affect the action. An action performed by the Communicator that brings about the communication. The state-of-affairs that the Communicator is attempting to bring about by communicating. The amount of time taken by the Communicator in creating and conveying the Summary. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

frame_definition: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
role_definitions: The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient. The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme. The object that is given to the Recipient . The Place where the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Explanation for which the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Time is when the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Purpose for which the Supplier gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Means by which the Supplier acquires or gives the Theme to the Recipient. Any description of the supplying event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of the Supplier that affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Circumstances are the conditions under which the Theme is supplied. The Recipient's intended purpose for the Theme. The period over which the Supplier engages in (multiple) supplying acts. An additional theme which is supplied along with the main Theme. The source of the Theme.

frame_definition: A Supporter assists to strengthen the Supported by lending itself in material aid (or abstract assistance in the case of metaphorical uses).
role_definitions: The Supporter acts to benefit the Supported by providing additional strength or stability. The Supported is given strength through the assistance of the Supporter. The measure to which the Supporter's assistance brings the Supported added strength and support. The time period during which the Supporter supports the Supported. An entity used by the Supporter in service of the Supported's strength by support. This role identifies the Manner in which a Supporter supports the Supported. An action that the Supporter undertakes in service of the Supported's strengthening. This role identifies the Place where the support occurs. This role identifies when the support occurs. The situation that the Supporter wishes to bring about by supporting the Supported. A state-of-affairs from which the accomplishment would be predicted. A clause describing the event as a whole.

frame_definition: A Surrenderer is compelled to transfer a Theme to a Recipient.
role_definitions: The person compelled to transfer the Theme to the Recipient. The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme. The object that changes possession. The Place where the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient. This role denotes a proposition from which the surrendering event logically follows. The Time is when the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Purpose for which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Means by which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient. The Manner is the manner in which the Surrenderer gives the Theme to the Recipient. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Surrendering event itself and any of its participants. This role modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function. This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. This role indicates the Communicative_force or authority with which the target operates (often denoted by words such as 'officially,' 'formally,' 'technically,' etc.). Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question how often. It is to be distinguished from Iteration, which pertains simply to the number of times an event occurs-Iteration expressions answer the question how many times. This role identifies the Result of an surrendering event. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.

frame_definition: An Agent removes a Theme from a Source so that the it is in the Agent's possession.
role_definitions: The person who takes possession of the Theme. The Agent takes possession of the Theme. The location of the Theme prior to the taking. Where the taking takes place. When the taking takes place. The Manner of the taking. The intermediate action taken by the Agent to take the Theme. The Purpose for the taking. The Explanation for the taking. The larger event which contains the Taking event.

frame_definition: A Speaker expresses through language his wish to get the Addressee to act.
role_definitions: The Speaker intends through the use of language to get another person to act. The wish for action on the Addressee's part that the Speaker expresses. The person that the Speaker seeks to influence to act. Act of the Speaker that enables them to persuade the Addressee. An entity that the Speaker gets the Addressee to give to them. The state of affairs that the Speaker hopes to bring about. An entity that the Speaker manipulates to get the Addressee to perform the Content. The location where the Speaker talks the Addressee into performing the Content.

frame_definition: A Guest stays for a time at a Location, which is not his or her permanent residence, for some Duration.
role_definitions: The Guest remains for a relatively short period of time in the Location. The Location where the Guest spends a short amount of time. The length of time that the Guest remains at the Location. Another person who, along with the Guest, is temporarily living at the Location. The time at which the temporary stay takes place. The Host is living at the Location on a permanent basis, and is allowing the Guest to stay there. The activity that the Guest hopes to achieve by the stay. An action of the Guest that brings about their ability to stay at the Location.
