Any description of the type of event by comparison to other events (the same way) or by characterizing a state of the Guest that affects the action. The average number of times the event occurs over a period. The number of times that the event occurs. A description of one of the participants in the temporary stay, or of the staying state-of-affairs in general. The Place indicates the larger physical setting of the temporary stay. A state of affairs that provides an explanation for the temporary stay. This role denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time of the temporary stay, and which is taken to be a part of the stay.

frame_definition: An Author creates a Text, either written, such as a letter, or spoken, such as a speech, that contains meaningful linguistic tokens, and may have a particular Addressee in mind.
role_definitions: The Author produces a particular Text. The Components are the parts that the Author uses to construct the Text. The entity which results from the act of writing or speaking. Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action The instrument with which an intentional act is performed. Where the event takes place. Manner of performing an action. This frame includes some peculiar examples of manner phrases. Write it in pen. Write it in ink. This role identifies the Means by which a Text is created. The purpose for which an intentional act is performed. This role identifies the Time at which the text is created. This is the person to whom the Message is communicated. When this role is expressed, it often appears in a prepositional phrase introduced by to, or as the direct object, or as the first object in a double object construction. Beneficiary identifies the person in whose honor or for whose benefit the Text is created. This role describes the form in which the text is presented. The Explanation for creating the text. The language in which the Text is represented or the physical materials upon which the Text is recorded.

frame_definition: These are words describing situations in which a Perpetrator takes Goods from a Victim or a Source.
role_definitions: Perpetrator is the person (or other agent) that takes the goods away. Victim is the person (or other sentient being or group) that owns the goods before they are taken away by the perpetrator. Goods is anything (including labor, time, or legal rights) that can be taken away. Source is the initial location of the goods, before they change location. This role identifies the Manner in which the theft occurs. This role identifies the Means by which a Perpetrator takes the Victim's Goods. This role identifies the Place where the theft occurs. This role identifies the Purpose for which a theft occurs. This role identifies the Explanation for why a theft occurs. This role identifies the Time when the theft occurs. An object used by the Perpetrator in taking possession of the Goods. The number of times that a theft occurs.

frame_definition: An Entity is in a state such that it participates in a preponderance of states and events which are desirable for it.
role_definitions: The Entity is experiencing a period of desirable events or states. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. The Time during which the Entity thrives. The Place where the thriving takes place. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. The category in which the Entity thrives. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state. The Explanation for why or how the Entity thrives. This role describes the state of the Entity. It is often incorporated into the LUs of this frame.

frame_definition: This frame involves a Donor transferring a Theme to a Recipient.
role_definitions: The entity that ends up in possession of the Theme. The object that changes ownership. The person that begins in possession of the Theme and causes it to be in the possession of the Recipient. Where the event takes place. The Explanation for which an event occurs. When the transfer occurs. The Donor and Recipient conceived of as a unit. The action whereby the transfer of the Theme from the Donor to the Recipient is effected. Any description of the transfer which is not covered by more specific FEs This role identifies the purpose for which a Theme is transferred

frame_definition: An Entity ends up with a particular new Final_quality.
role_definitions: Where the change takes place. When the change occurs. The length of time that the Entity retains the Final_quality. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In cases where the Entity is intentional, Manner may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional Entity that also affect the event (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Entity which undergoes a change so that it possesses the Final_quality. The quality that the Entity has at the end of the event. The period during which the Entity is in transition. This role marks the set of conditions under which the Entity adopts Final_quality. A characterization of the kind of Group members that the Entity pertains to, and which are saliently affected by its change. Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the Entity.

frame_definition: A Cognizer produces a Target_symbol which represents, in the Target_representation format, a Content that pre-exists in the form of a Source_symbol in a Source_representation format. ''
role_definitions: This is the person who carries out the translation. A symbol or set of symbols representing the Content in the Source_representation format. The representation system in which the Content pre-exists. Any description of the translation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the Cognizer that also affect the action (deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An intentional action performed by the Cognizer which accomplishes the translation of the Content. This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made. The Circumstances are the set of conditions in which the translation is made. A symbol or set of symbols representing the Content in the Target_representation format. The representation system into which the Content is rendered by the Cognizer. The information that is meant to be represented by the Source_symbol and Target_symbol. An assessment of how equivalent the Source_representation and the Target_representation are. The Medium is a text produced by the Cognizer in which she uses a Target_symbol to express Content from a Source_representation system. The location where the translation takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Cognizer hopes to bring about by translating.

frame_definition: A Rider is being transported in a Vehicle, or is moving on foot.
role_definitions: The Rider is being transported by a Vehicle. The Vehicle carries the Rider.

frame_definition: A Theme changes location with respect to a salient location, which can be expressed by a Source, Path, Goal, Area, Direction, Path_shape, or Distance, as shown in the examples below: '' 'Start your ascent from Achintree Farm in Glen Nevis.'
role_definitions: This is the object which moves. In many sentences this role will be expressed as something which moves under its own power. However, this role is not required to be an animate mover, so it is different from Self_mover. Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion expresses the frame element Source. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context. Any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal (see below) expresses the frame element Path, including directional expressions: Any expression which tells where the Theme ends up as a result of the motion expresses the frame element Goal. Any expression which describes a property of motion which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion expresses the frame element Manner. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. Any expression which characterizes the extent of motion expresses the frame element Distance. This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path. Degree to which event occurs An event involving the Theme that results in the Theme moving in the specified way. The Speed is the rate at which the Theme moves. This is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique: Depictive phrase describing the actor of an action The Place is where the motion (which is specified by a Source, Path or Goal) is located. The configuration formed by the entire Path of the Theme, taken simultaneously. The direction in which the Theme goes. The time at which the motion takes place. The state-of-affairs that the Theme wishes to bring about. The device or bodypart that serves to move the Theme. The length of time that the Theme spends in motion. The state of the Theme at the end of the event. A factor which explains the particular motion or manner of motion of the Theme. An event paired with the motion, which explains why the motion is expected. In particular, or an action that Reciprocation is used to indicate an action that is being rewarded or punished by the motion, is paired with the motion as the other side of an agreement. An event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at the time the Traversing occurs and which the Traversing is taken to be a part of. The number of times that an action occurs in a given time. A larger conceptualization that includes the Traversing as an integral part. The Traversing expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action in this larger conceptualization. An unexpected event that affects some agent (usually the Theme), which is enabled by, and occurs after, the Traversing. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Traversing event itself and any of its participants, and is merely peripherally related to the event as a whole. The Source and Goal of either a single or a repeated motion taken together as Endpoints of the Path. The label Coordinated_event is to be used for phrases denoting an event-it does not allow states-that the Traversing is rhythmically aligned with. The Coordinated_event is conceived of as independent: it would occur regardless of the event expressed by the target, which is not even an incidental or optional sub-part of the Coordinated_event. The time period within which the motion event occurs repeatedly. In general, this role is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function. The frame element Iterations is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held.

frame_definition: An Entity changes, either in its category membership, its situation, or in terms of the quality of an Attribute.
role_definitions: The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change. The type of Entity that results from the change. The category that the Entity belongs to before it undergoes the change. The time at which the Entity undergoes the transformation. The value of the Attribute before the change takes place. The quality of the Attribute that results from the change. A characteristic of the Entity for which a quality can be assigned or determined by calculation, measurement, or observation. Any description of the Change event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The extent to which the initial and final categories, situations, or qualities differ from each other. The physical or abstract Circumstances under which the change takes place. An event or state that causes the change to take place. A value that the Attribute assumes before the Final_value obtains. The Initial_value and Final_value taken together as the range through which the Entity changes. The main faith of the church has changed between Orthodox, Protestant and Greek Catholic several times. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The location that the change takes place. The Entity's situation that results from the change. The situation that the Entity began in.

frame_definition: An Entity changes from one kind of thing (Initial_category) to another kind of thing (Final_category).
role_definitions: The concrete or abstract entity that undergoes a change. The type of Entity that results from the change. The category that the Entity belongs to before it undergoes the change. The time at which the Entity undergoes the transformation. Any description of the Transformation event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). The extent to which the initial and final categories differ from each other. The physical or abstract Circumstances under which the change takes place. An event or state that causes the change to take place. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The location that the change takes place.

frame_definition: An Entity is affected by an Event.
role_definitions: The thing which is affected by the Event. A change in the world which affects the Entity. The Time at which the Entity undergoes the Event. The location at which the Entity undergoes the Event. The Explanation for which the Entity undergoes the Event. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. The Purpose for which the Entity undergoes the Event. Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly) and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants.

frame_definition: An Agent causes a Firearm to discharge, usually directing the projectile from the barrel of the Firearm (the Source), along a Path, and to a Goal. '
role_definitions: The self-directed entity that uses and activates the Firearm. This role identifies the Firearm that an Agent activates so that it rapidly propels a projectile. This role identifies the means by which an Agent uses the Firearm. This role identifies the manner in which an Agent uses the Firearm. This role identifies the place where the Agent intentionally affects the Patient. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the firearm. This role identifies the Time when the Agent fires the Firearm. Goal is the location the Theme ends up in, or is intended to end up in. This is the path along which the projectiles travel. The Source is the location of the Firearm from which projectiles originate. Area is the setting in which the projectile's movement takes place. This role identifies the number of times a firearm is used. Depicitive phrase describing the state of a participant in the action.

frame_definition: An Agent manipulates an Instrument in order to achieve a Purpose.
role_definitions: The Agent uses the Instrument to achieve their Purpose. This role identifies the place where the Agent uses the Instrument. This role identifies the purpose for which an Agent uses the Instrument. This role identifies the time when the Agent uses the Instrument. This role identifies the Means by which an Agent uses the Instrument. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action ( deliberately, eagerly, carefully). An entity directed by the Agent that serves to bring about the Purpose of the Agent. An Instrument that has a function associated with it. The Outcome is the failure or success of the Agent's using the Instrument to achieve their Purpose. An event within which the Agent uses the Instrument. Often, the Containing_event will also give an indication of the Agent's Purpose. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time. A Frequency expression answers the question 'how often.' This role modifies a clause with an iterative interpretation, which may be signified by the simple present tense on the main verb. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. The depicted state does not necessarily or usually facilitate or cause the state of affairs reported by the target. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the target's proposition, but not in all cases. This role identifies the population within which the Using event occurs. This frame element selects some gradable attribute of the Instrument or the Using act and modifies the expected value for it. Duration denotes the length of time from the beginning of a continuous situation to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.

frame_definition: A flying Vehicle comes to the ground at a Goal in a controlled fashion, typically (but not necessarily) operated by an operator.
role_definitions: The Vehicle comes to the ground, usually (but not necessarily) under the control of an operator. Source is any expression which implies a definite starting-point of motion. While Source expressions are possible in this frame, they are relatively infrequent. Path is any description of a trajectory of motion which is neither a Source nor a Goal. In this frame, Path expressions almost always have a via-sense. Goal is any expression that tells where the Vehicle ends up, or would end up, as a result of the motion. A Manner expression describes a property of landing which is not directly related to the trajectory of motion. Descriptions of speed, steadiness, grace, means of motion, and other things count as Manner expressions. This role identifies the Means by which a Vehicle lands. The Mode_of_transportation expresses how the motion of the Vehicle is effected, by its body or by a vehicle which holds and conveys the Vehicle. Cotheme is the second moving object, expressed as a direct object or an oblique. This role identifies the Time when the aircraft lands. The New_situation are the state of the Goal when the Vehicle arrives. The Depictive is a phrase which describes the state of the Vehicle upon arrival. The time period within which the landing event repeats multiple times. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the landing event itself and any of its participants. This role identifies the purpose for which the Vehicle lands at the Goal. This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it. This role marks the state of affairs reported by the landing event as understood to play a role in the state of affairs of Event_description This role presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action. How often the Vehicle lands at the Goal. This role identifies the Place where the landing occurs.

frame_definition: An Agent matches location with an Entity in order to fulfill some Purpose.
role_definitions: The sentient entity that is temporarily with the Entity in order to fulfil some Purpose. The physical entity that is permanently associated with entities or characteristics that the Agent wishes to use for some Purpose. During the visit, the Agent matches location with the Entity. A state (of the Agent) that results as a consequence of the Agent being situated at the Entity. The activity that is enabled by the Entity and that the Agent wishes to achieve. The location that the Agent normally resides in or is (permanently) associated with. The time at which a visit is made. The amount of time that the Agent spends with the Entity. Any overall description of the details of the visit, either in terms of how it matches other events (the same way) or in terms of states of the Agent that affect the action. A description of the position of the Agent during the visit. An action of the Agent that enables their visit. The number of instances of the described event. A characterization of the average number of times a visit happens over a period of time. A description of the state of Agent or Entity during the action.

frame_definition: A Sleeper transitions from a state of consciousness where they are largely unaware of their environment to a wakeful state.
role_definitions: This role identifies the Place where the event occurs. This role identifies the sleeping entity. This role identifies the Time when the event occurs. This describes the state out of which the Sleeper awakens. The Manner in which the Sleeper awakens. The state of the Sleeper upon waking up. The New_situation is the situation the Sleeper finds him or herself in upon awaking. Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. This role indicates an instance of the Waking_up event within an iterated series of similar events or states. The reason for which the Sleeper awakes from the Sleep_state. This frame element is defined as the number of times an event occurs per some unit of time.

frame_definition: An Agent expends effort towards achieving a Goal.
role_definitions: The Agent puts effort into reaching Goal. The Goal is what the Agent expends effort to achieve. The Outcome is the failure or success of an attempt to achieve a Goal. This role identifies the Means by which the effort is done. This role identifies the Degree to which an attempt occurs. This role identifies the Time when the effort occurs. The Depictive is a phrase which describes the Agent. The place where the work is done. The Manner in which the Agent puts in effort in acheiving the Goal. The time peiod over which the work takes place. The reason for which the Agent puts effort into achieving the Goal. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to. The state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is independent of the the attempt of the Agent to achieve the Goal. The domain or area within which the work towards the Goal belongs. An entity that is centrally involved in the Goal that the Agent is attempting to acheive. How often the Agent works. This role applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness. Descriptor covers any characterization or description of the target that is not covered by another more specific FE.

frame_definition: The Agent is assigned to a Post where he or she performs a task associated with that Post.
role_definitions: The Agent is assigned to a Post to perform a task involving a Salient_entity. This role identifies the place where the Agent staffs the Post. This role identifies the purpose for which the Agent works at the Post. This role identifies the time when the Agent works at the Post. This role identifies the Means by which the Agent works at the Post. Any description of the intentional act which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). In addition, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). The Frequency with which the Agent works in a given period of time. The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped. The Result of working at the Post. Expressions marked with this extra-thematic role modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. The Explanation denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. This often means that the Explanation causes the state of affairs expressed by the target, but not in all cases. This role gives a description of the working event. The Post is a location or station assigned to the Agent where a task or tasks are to be performed. The Salient_entity is centrally involved in the task the Agent is assigned to perform. It is normally located at the Post.
